jobTitle: 300mm North Texas Industrial Engineering Execution Manager
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job The Dallas 300mm Industrial Engineering team is looking for an accomplished Industrial Engineer/Manufacturing engineer with leadership experience to join their growing team. The job requires working in a wafer fab cleanroom. The desired candidate will have previous experience transitioning to new roles quickly and effectively, learning new concepts, and being self-motivated to meet objectives in a rapid paced work environment. The candidate must be both a leader and a team player who can work effectively with managers, supervisors and engineers across different organizations to achieve business goals in a 300mm highly automated wafer fab environment. The ability to understand and analyze huge amount of data at high speed with great accuracy is key to be successfully in this position. Having experience in leading a lean and efficient team of engineers in a manufacturing environment and a strong foundation of industrial engineering methodology is required. Roles And Responsibilities Will Include Leading a team of highly effective industrial engineers to support and drive manufacturing operating plan Regularly supervise the work of personnel, provide opinions and conduct performance assessments Ability to influence and collaborate across internal and external organizations to support execution plan Excel at completing projects accurately and timely Driving capacity entitlement Driving manufacturing continuous improvement initiatives Leading manufacturing performance gap analysis Identifying opportunities to improve execution and cycle time Strong ability to utilize industrial engineering concepts and operational research concepts to assist in manufacturing decision making Strong data analysis skills and statistical analysis skills is required to support operational needs Creating and implementing development and training plan to support IE team growth and skills upgrade Must be comfortable working in a clean room environment wearing cleanroom required garments Minimum Requirements Must have a Bachelor's degree in industrial engineering (preferably master degree in industrial engineering) Minimum 6 years of experience working as an industrial engineer (or equivalent) in manufacturing field, preferably in semiconductor manufacturing Minimum 3 years of supervisory/management experience Preferred Qualifications & Skills Strong communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively across functional boundaries and with upper management. Ability to build and sustain strong relationships with peers during difficult and stressful situations, and able to negotiate and drive solutions. Team Player. Must be able to work effectively across functional and cultural boundaries. Exhibit leadership qualities and willingness to work within a team environment. Experience working with factory simulation software (example: AutoSched AP), factory dispatching system (example: RTD), and MES would be a major advantage. Unique Selling Features Of The Job Be part of a strong team working in the most cutting edge environment with high growth potential. Opportunities to learn new skill sets and being mentor by industry leaders. We believe in thinking outside the box and exercise your creative abilities to help solve complex and dynamic problems. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. Manufacturing

About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! Top-level Responsibilities About the job Help define and deploy QML Class P requirements at TI. Grow A&D revenue by providing strategy leadership to integrate industry requirements across TI where applicable. Participate and Represent TI in Industry conferences such as JEDEC/SAE. Additional Responsibilities/details Proactively and regularly engage with Business Units and A&D SMEs. Own the development of new process requirements and updates existing specs per MIL specs requirements. Manage DLA certifications and help coordinate audits. Help review changes affecting A&D devices. The role has a high-level of responsibility and visibility across TI and A&D Industry. Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree in STEM Experience in Aerospace and Defense Experienced in Military specifications (Mil-STD-883 and MIL-PRF-38535) Effective communicator and skills to interact with all stakeholder Demonstrated ability to identify and implement systemic solutions. Degreed in STEM ITAR Restriction: All candidates for this ITAR restricted position must be one of the following: US Citizen or U.S. Permanent Resident, Asylee, Refugee or otherwise lawfully admitted under an amnesty program. Preferred Qualifications Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Texas Instruments is looking for organized and analytical individuals to fulfill Financial and Cost Accountant opportunities. As an Accountant at TI, you would be responsible for a variety of accounting compliance, financial reporting, and internal control activities to assist management and stakeholders in decision making. At TI, our passion is to create a better world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors, and as an accountant you will share an exciting front seat in helping achieve those results and shape the future. Responsibilities Include Accounting compliance, accuracy, and financial integrity Support statutory audit, internal audit, and SOX Compliance Timely, accurate execution of accounting activities, which may include monthly close, inventory costing, journal entries, cost classification and analysis, and financial reviews Ensure robust controls for accounting processes and close activities, compliance reporting, and financial entries Vendor payment compliance – Statutory and TI Policies Liaison with the other TI sites and business partners for best practice sharing and process improvements Implement new processes to improve efficiencies tracking and reporting capital assets Automate, enhance & document processes where necessary Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA Knowledge of US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and accounting standards Systems knowledge/skills including: Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); SAP a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills Outstanding analytical skills, critical and creative thinking, problem-solving abilities, and detail-oriented Preferred Qualifications Strong leadership and initiative Excellent organizational skills Effective communication skills at all levels of the organization Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Why TI? We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Validation engineers are said to have a "break-the-part" mentality. This means they spend some of their time working to identify the use-cases in which the device will stop working as intended and understand the impact and cause of those failures. Sometimes, those are acceptable failures, but others we may need to mitigate for quality, safety, or other reasons. Plus, we want to ensure that our parts are consistently performing to the specifications that we set in our data sheet, and even to some more conservative limits or as defined in the VVCM (validation/verification compliance matrix). To do this, they must design PCB boards and develop automation software that will increase coverage and reduce data collection time. Validation engineers will also design, develop, and implement necessary methods of measuring device performance and troubleshooting any related systems, equipment or device issues that arise. Validation engineers are often working in a post-silicon lab or on the software programs required to run their measurements. In this role you will be responsible for post silicon validation of precision Analog-to-Digital converters. Minimum Requirements Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field of study 2+ years of experience Coding and automation - C++/java/Labview/Python/etc Hands on lab experience Preferred Qualifications Experience working with ADCs Ability to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders critical to success, both internally and externally Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly ramp on new systems and processes Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Why TI? We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. The Advanced Materials and Processes (AMP) Process Development Engineer will be responsible for identifying, developing, characterizing, and improving semiconductor unit processes and associated materials to meet program requirements for TI's newest generation of devices. This exciting opportunity often involves bringing in new materials, processes, or equipment to TI for the first time. The job responsibility will be accomplished through direct hands-on development activity in an advanced semiconductor fabrication facility. The engineer will work in a cross-functional team between the Analog Technology Development (ATD) group and a key manufacturing facility, and have significant interactions with equipment and material suppliers, characterization labs, and other groups (test, packaging, product groups). Strong communications skills are a must. Preferred background/thesis work includes: hands-on research/characterization of chemical or mechanical processes (preferably semiconductor unit process). Preferred coursework: Semiconductor device physics and processing combined with strong foundation in physics, chemistry, materials science, and/or chemical kinetics/thermodynamics. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. As a analog IC design engineering intern, you’ll architect new TI products and make our customers’ visions a reality. You’ll define, design, model, implement and document analog, digital, and RF integrated circuits (ICs). And, you’ll have the opportunity to work in exciting areas like audio, imaging, high-speed, interface, clocking, medical, high volume linear, automotive, storage, power supply, battery management, linear power and many more. Some of your responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to: You could be working on problems that arise from design-process interaction that is not captured by conventional models and simulation techniques. Circuit analysis enables optimization of new technologies and designs and is critical to new product and technology ramps. The new graduate will have to collaborate with his/her peers and leverage their experience and available resources to complement their skills and integrate quickly with the team. Could be responsible for characterization and optimization to support next generation Power Technology development programs. Drive the characterization of new and novel device structures to ensure robustness, reliability, and manufacturability. Provide feedback and recommendation to architect on improvements, based on characterization date and follow on device simulation. Work with multiple characterization engineers, and device engineers to achieve these goals. As a design engineer, you will have the opportunity to work with TI’s industry-leading analog products for precision analog, power management, imaging, audio, high-speed converter and interface applications. This specialist will be exposed to a variety of technologies from deep-submicron and analog CMOS to RF heterojunction and high-voltage SOI BiCMOS. This position provides an excellent view of the entire commercial semiconductor flow from technology development, to productization support and circuit design, to product qualification. Specific Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Development of strategies for continuously monitoring the impact of process changes and convert into a design framework Development, generation, delivery, and support of Process Design Kit( PDK) collateral Develop, qualify, support and improve existing physical layout verification, schematic verification, Parameterized Cells (Pcell) and parasitic extraction tools within PDK Development and support of QA tests written in a Linux-based QA tool/system Put your talent to work with us as a Design Engineer Intern – change the world, love your job! About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job If you are looking to join an ingenious, vigorous & ambitious team that consistently delivers groundbreaking technologies into the custom mobile electronics world, here is an opportunity for you! The ACS product line is delivering industry leading custom IC system solutions including camera PMICs, power switches/muxes, Laser drivers, High speed comms interface & touch signal chain products. This is a great opportunity to be part of the best custom semiconductor team in the world. Basic Qualifications The ideal candidate will have proven skillset in the field of analog and mixed signal design with passion and excitement to participate in Tier1 custom IC development. The candidate should have demonstrated experience in driving analog design innovation and best practices across their organization. The candidate will also work independently with little supervision to design complex analog circuits or lead projects with multiple, cross-functional engineers; operate with complete block/project ownership to drive all aspects of the block/project to successful completion in the committed schedule; be able to manage design workloads and delegate tasks for project success; deliver accurate, aggressive, but attainable design schedules to the product team and customers; manage the design phase of the project to efficiently utilize scarce project resources; anticipate and highlight any/all risks in the design schedule during the planning phase of the project and implement plans to mitigate these risks; as well as drive high level, dynamic interaction with customers/sales in technical meetings. Must have theoretical background and practical experience in mixed-signal IC design. Competency in the analysis, transistor level design and system implementation of at least several of following basic analog functions including amplifiers, bandgaps, comparators, LDO’s, charge pumps, ADC, DACs, or switching regulators. Must be capable of hand (i.e. pen and paper) analysis as well as working knowledge and familiarity with simulation tools (i.e. SPICE, Spectre, VHDL, etc.). In This Role, Responsibilities May Include Direct, guide and participate in activities of a research or technical design function responsible for designing, developing, modifying and evaluating electronic parts, components, integrated circuits for a variety of applications Make assignments for team members, providing design guidance as needed, developing schedules and monitoring progress throughout the project Evaluate intermediate and final results of projects during the design phase and during silicon evaluation, to ensure accomplishment of technical objectives Work with and provide guidance to physical designers and monitors the progress of IC layout Collaborate with Design Verification teams during the pre-PG phase of a project to ensure completion of all technical tasks before PG Work with systems engineers, application engineers and marketing to prepare product briefs, datasheets, application notes and assisting in the definition of the product to meet customer needs as well as contributing to roadmap formulation and new concept creation Collaborate with validation, product engineering and test engineering teams to enable successful transfer to production Interface and lead discussions with the customer and/or TI field sales/field applications teams to understand customer designs, problems and support as required Actively participate in hiring, developing and evaluating personnel to ensure efficient operation of the organization and growth of the individuals into leader Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field of study 4+ years of relevant experience Additional Preferred Qualifications Deep understanding of semiconductor IC processing, semiconductor packaging, and production test solutions is desirable. Solid understanding and familiarity with advanced IC CAD tools including top-down methodologies (i.e.VHDL, Cosim, etc.) are highly desirable. Expertise in BCD process technologies System level understanding and analysis; and the ability to translate requirements to an IC spec level IC system partitioning and signal chain analysis, architectural tradeoff analysis Active involvement with a customers. Candidate would be expected to interact and collaborate with a sense of ownership with customers and all product development team members including design, layout, systems, applications, verification, validation, product, test and program management Block level topology selection, hand analysis, and IC transistor level implementation Schematic generation and simulation on modern CAD tools (Cadence tool set) Worst case identification, top level simulation, Monte Carlo analysis, and simulation data analysis Physical layout management, signal grounding and routing tradeoffs, die area optimization Post layout parasitic extraction and simulation, verification of all IC level performance metrics Top level verification, block level modeling, top level simulation Must budget time, manage schedule and complete complex IC design tasks on time Must have depth of experience and meticulous approach to assure high quality results Must account for limitations of system level specifications, testability, debug, characterization, production and yield targets in the IC design phase. Must work well with colleagues and customers to foster a highly creative, interesting, productive and fun working environment. Organizational Skills: Ability to work well with internal cross functional teams. Must successfully and appropriately interface with external customers. Project management, time management, multi-tasking, problem solving and communication (written and oral) are important skills in this role. Must be able to manage assigned tasks with minimal supervision. Team and People Skills: Candidate must be team oriented and must be able to work with TI-internal and external groups (systems, test, sales, marketing, customers, etc.) to resolve issues and generate business success. The ability to work well with others and to perform in a team environment is essential. Projects and Deliverables: The main deliverable is the timely release of meticulously analyzed and simulated IC designs or sub-sections of designs for custom designs with tight schedules. These designs should lead to cost-effective, high quality, bug-free products that fully meet our customer’s end-system requirements. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. Engineering

jobTitle: Analog Design Engineer - ESD Product Specialist
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job As an ESD Product Specialist, you will have the opportunity to work with TI’s industry-leading analog products for precision analog, power management, imaging, audio, high-speed converter and interface applications. You will be exposed to a variety of technologies from deep-submicron and analog CMOS to RF heterojunction and high-voltage SOI BiCMOS. This position provides an excellent view of the entire commercial semiconductor flow from technology development to productization support and circuit design, to product qualification; yielding a platform for strong interaction with technology development, product, and reliability groups. Responsibilities Include The primary purpose of the ESD Product Specialist is to improve design quality and eliminate unwanted design passes caused by ESD-induced failures, while continually improving ESD protection effectiveness and area efficiency. Design, develop and implement ESD protection structures for analog products using TI’s analog processes and foundry technologies. Perform ESD reviews on TI analog products and I/O cells. Perform ESD troubleshooting on TI analog products that fail internal, or customer, qualification requirements. Assist with the design and development of test structures for ESD assessment of TI’s analog process technologies. Maintain ESD protection structure libraries and ESD design guideline documents to be used by TI design engineers and I/O cell developers. Put your talent to work with us as a Analog Design Engineer – change the world, love your job! Minimum Requirements Minimum Doctorate in Electrical Engineering or Physics or Masters with 2 years relevant experience to the role Minimum Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results To be considered for this position, please apply. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Program As a design engineer in our Analog Design Rotation Program, you’ll be a member of a leading-edge team driving architecture and development of new TI SERDES transceivers for state-of-the-art self-driving cars and networking products and make our customers’ visions a reality. You’ll have the opportunity to be a part of the design team involved in modeling, design and implementation of high performance analog mixed signal integrated circuits for high-speed SERDES transceiver ICs. Accelerate your development with a variety of rotations during the program. You will work on circuit design – learning how to layout, verify the design and use sophisticated design tools. Then you’ll validate, test and troubleshoot how your designs work once manufactured. Get exposure early on in your career as you learn the life cycle of a product design and gain a deeper understanding of product development, so you are fully equipped to hit the ground running on your own designs. Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Providing high-level analysis of on-chip circuit architectures and understand trade-offs to ensure specification compliance resulting in superior performance at a competitive cost. IC design and yield analysis including creation of circuit blocks schematics to the specification and running systematic and statistical cadence pre-layout simulations. Supervising IC layouts to ensure high-performance operation and adoption of best analog and mixed signal physical development and practices. Deriving behavioral models for analog mixed signal circuit blocks. Participating in design reviews and creating the necessary design and product documentation. Characterizing prototypes, developing test specifications and coordinating with test/product engineering to drive product releases. Minimum Requirements Qualifications - External Master of Science in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Technology, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field Minimum Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA In-depth understanding of high performance analog mixed signal circuit IC design fundamentals such as design tradeoffs in gain-bandwidth, offset, linearity, noise, etc. Preferred Qualifications Prior exposure to end to end IC design cycle in cadence using advanced deep sub-micron CMOS technologies. Background and/or coursework in digitally assisted calibration circuits for high-speed analog circuits. Background and/or coursework in digital communication and signal processing theories and fundamentals. Hands-on modeling and verification skills for circuit blocks using Matlab, Python, etc. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions. Ability to take the initiative and drive for results. Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery. Working well in a team environment is imperative in this role. Good listener and excellent verbal and written communication skills. To be considered for this position, please apply. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. Our Santa Clara site is in the heart of Silicon Valley in California, enabling close relationships with many of our key customers, engagement with Silicon Valley start-ups and access to R&D centers from worldwide corporations. Since the weather is pleasant year-round, you’ll often find employees eating lunch outside by the pond, playing volleyball or walking around the lush campus. Our proximity to the Caltrain station makes it easy to jump on the train to go to San Jose or San Francisco. Outside of work, our employees enjoy the many outdoor activities within close proximity to the Bay Area such as hiking, backpacking, camping, skiing, surfing, boating, kayaking, mountain biking, whitewater rafting, etc. You can head up to Napa and Sonoma to explore wine country. You can head south and ATV on the beach. There are loads of breweries, bars, and incredible restaurants, both in San Francisco, San Jose, and the smaller cities in between. There are almost too many options. As an added bonus, you almost never have to worry about the weather, because it only rains for a few months in the wintertime. jobTitle: Analog IC Design Rotation Program - MS/PhD - Arizona
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. As an Analog Design Engineer, you’ll create integrated circuit designs that help bring new TI products to life and make our customers’ visions a reality. You’ll define, design, model, implement and document analog, digital and/or RF integrated circuits (ICs). And, you’ll have the opportunity to work in exciting areas like audio, imaging, high-speed, interface, clocking, medical, high volume linear, automotive, storage, power supply, battery management, linear power and many more. You’ll help define and then design, simulate, and implement analog integrated circuits in silicon. You’ll be working on state-of-the-art wafer processes and learning from and collaborating with industry experts. To accelerate your development and give you a breadth of experience early on, you will get to participate in various design-related roles over the first 24 months as part of the Analog Design Program. Understanding the various aspects of product development will help you become a better designer. You will spend time performing typical “front-end” design activities such as designing and drawing the schematics, simulating for functionality and parametric performance, and assisting in the IC layout and then running post-layout extracted simulations. You’ll also gain exposure to other “back-end” activities such as bench characterization, final test, and failure analysis. This is a great way to apply knowledge from your circuit design coursework and see how designs progress in the real world. At the end of this program, you will be ready to hit the ground running on your own designs! Put your talent to work with us as a Design Engineer – change the world, love your job! Minimum Requirements Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Technology, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA or higher Preferred Qualifications Proven outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills in analog integrated circuit coursework Transistor-level semiconductor device knowledge and understanding Ability to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders critical to success, both internally and externally Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly ramp on new systems and processes Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Why TI? jobTitle: Analog Power IC Design Engineer - Custom Power Products
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. About The Job If you are looking to join an ingenious, vigorous, ambitious, dynamic and talented team that consistently delivers groundbreaking technologies into the custom power world, here is an opportunity for you! The Custom Power Products product line is delivering industry leading power system solutions including Battery Chargers, PMICs, Camera Flash LED drivers etc. This is a great opportunity to be part of the best custom power semiconductor team in the world. In This Role, Responsibilities May Include Lead an Analog IC design team with product ownership and responsibility from definition to release to manufacturing Translate system requirements to chip and block level architecture and specifications Design high performance PMIC blocks including high efficiency switching regulators Make assignments for team members, providing design guidance as needed, developing schedules and monitoring progress throughout the project Work with and provide guidance to physical designers and monitors the progress of IC layout Collaborate with validation, product engineering and test engineering teams to enable successful transfer to production Evaluate system-level use-cases and re-create these in simulation Interface and lead discussions with the customer to understand customer designs, problems and support as required Actively participate in hiring, developing and evaluating personnel to ensure efficient operation of the organization and growth of the individuals into leader Minimum Requirements Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field of study Minimum 7+ years of relevant experience Extensive background in Power IC design Preferred Qualifications Extensive experience in switching DCDC regulators design e.g. multi-phase buck, boost and buck-boost converters. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is out front and ready for the next big challenge. Our innovations are at the core of nearly every electronics product in use today. And it doesn’t stop there. We’re developing breakthrough technology to power the world’s future innovations as well. TI is committed to building a better future — from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities. Put your talent to work with us. Our business has very high growth in TI and is in a segment where the market is fast growing. We’re searching for applications engineer who have the passion and excitement to grow, innovative, take an active role in product definition, execute the characterization until ramp, and provide post ramp application support to customers. This role is responsible for application support for high speed Wireless Infrastructure products. Key responsibilities include: Answer customer questions and supporting design-in activities for released products. Forum and email questions from customers. Schematic and Layout Review of customer application. Debug of customer problems by re-creating issues in our evaluation boards and/or customer boards. On-site support for customer board as required. Design EVM and internal evaluation boards to support correlation and evaluation activities of new products. Create user guides, test procedures, and proper release of EVM boards for customer consumption. Participate in new silicon testing from an application perspective to ensure robustness of the product. Write application notes that explain different use cases, implementation, and/or flexibility of our products. Verify key features inside the RF transceivers and develop the verification result into applications note for customers. Test and characterize customer specific use case scenarios to ensure robustness and quality of the RF transceiver design in customer systems. Participate in datasheet review to ensure completeness of datasheet being developed by the systems engineers. Work with systems and marketing engineers to provide support to early design in activities for new products. Create custom reference designs targeting relevant applications to be used as customer implementation ideas. BS in Electrical Engineering or related field of study 3+ years of relevant experience including the following aspects: Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions. Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery. Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. Ability to take the initiative and drive for results. Preferred: experience in multi-cultural customer support. Good understanding of RF and microwave components, systems, and measurements. Knowledge of measurements techniques and experience in interpreting the measurement results. RF board issues debugging skills (capability to identify possible sources of RF performance degradation). Laboratory automation skills Preferred: good understanding of Python automation. High speed mixed signal PCB debug skills Ability to express basic understanding of digital data bus, data signal integrity, diagnostic of bit errors, and various hand-shaking protocol errors. Preferred: experiences in PCI-E, JESD204, Ethernet, HDMI/Display Port. Describe and demonstrate skill set in either board level integration or device-to-device level integration. Examples of board level or device-to-device level integration include building prototypes with available off the shelf FPGA EVMs and interfacing with various analog front end capture cards. Strong background in signal processing and communications systems. Preferred: demonstrate good understanding of basic detection and estimation theories (i.e. mean square error and decision feedback equalizer) and the associated matrix/matrices inversions. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Texas Instruments designs and develops high-performance, low-power devices with advanced, integrated radio sub-systems for use in a variety of wireless applications from industrial, medical to automotive. Applications Engineers in TI’s Low Power Connectivity Solutions product line are technical experts on Low Power Radio Frequency (RF) products. We have a strong customer commitment and a great team spirit. If you are looking for an interesting and challenging position with a wide range of exciting responsibilities, you’ve come to the right place. About The Job Come join our Connectivity Automotive Applications team and help drive the development and adoption of our wireless microcontrollers for both Car Access, Wireless Battery Management Systems (WBMS) and Tire Pressure Monitoring Systems (TPMS). You will be an integral part of our team leading the revolution of connectivity in automotive use cases, and specifically be involved in our team focused on Bluetooth Low Energy and our TI WBMS Protocol. We’re looking for a SW applications engineer who has the passion and excitement to grow in this position, innovate, and take an active role in supporting automotive customers as they design, ramp and manufacture their products with TI connectivity products inside. This position requires someone who enjoys working in an international environment and brings a positive “can do” attitude to their objectives. In this position you’ll work with closely with TI customers to determine their design challenges and partner with them on creating solutions, design optimization and improving their products. This can involve travelling to the customer and working together on-site to solve any issues and deliver presentations both in-house and onsite. You will spend hands-on time in a world-class lab tackling technical challenges and delivering innovative development solutions that support our products and drive revenue. Become a part of the team that won the 2022 gold for Wireless Communications from Elektronik for the impact we are making in the embedded automotive space with our WBMS protocol! Responsibilities Include Working with Automotive Tier 1s and OEMs to design and implement next generation wireless connectivity applications in Car Access, TPMS and WBMS. Direct, high-volume technical customer support through Sales and FAE collaboration and on-site as required for critical engagement Work with systems engineers to provide support to early design in activities for new product Provides inputs for future product development based on customer application specifications and market trends Collaboration with hardware and software design teams to support customer needs, implement custom features in FW, build/design/document/test application hardware/software solutions. Providing support through forum and direct customer contact, design review of customer applications and resolution of customer issues by re-creating/debugging to root-cause. Accelerating customer development process by ensuring that customers’ technical requirements are met and problems resolved. Creating collateral like application notes, software documentation, trainings and webinars for enabling a broad customer base for TI. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. This is your chance to innovate a better world. In our challenging and collaborative Applications Engineer Rotation Program, you’ll get to use your technical and creative engineering skills while gaining valuable experience working with real customers and real products on solving real business problems. Applications Engineers at Texas Instruments (TI) are a highly-motivated, synergistic group with great team spirit and a strong commitment to the customer. In this role, you will promote TI products and provide technical solutions to customers that will ultimately go into consumer products like smartphones, PC peripherals, personal medical devices, electric cars, e-bikes and much more. You’ll also provide technical support and engage with customers to help define new products and opportunities for future product development. As a program participant, you’ll work on breakthrough technologies through two six-month assignments which could be within a variety of business unit (product line) organizations. Rotation Assignments Are Available In Two Main Areas Business Unit Applications, where you will build expertise in one of our product families by helping define and release new products and support our customers through their design cycles. Systems Engineering, where you will build expertise in end equipment systems by learning industry needs & trends, solving customer design challenges, and converting opportunities. Rotations are hands-on, technical and problem-solving focused with the goal of helping you to create compelling solutions and win business for TI. Every day can look different due to the variety of customers you will engage with! At the end of your program, you’ll become a member of one of our applications teams, where you will have direct responsibility for understanding the product group through the eyes of the customer and solving problems to gain share within our customer accounts. And it doesn’t stop there. You’ll be mentored along the way by the best and the brightest engineering minds and take part in customized learning opportunities. You may have the chance to travel to TI sites and customer facilities within your region of the world, and gain meaningful experience working directly with global team members and customers. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in content publishing, develop training materials, and/or teach and share knowledge broadly through TI.com. Put your talent to work with us in our Applications Engineer Rotation Program – change the world, love your job! jobTitle: ATD Reliability Engineer – High Voltage GaN
jobDescription: About TI As a global semiconductor company operating in 35 countries, Texas Instruments (TI) is first and foremost a reflection of its people. From the TIer who unveiled the first working integrated circuit in 1958 to the more than 30,000 TIers around the world today who design, manufacture and sell analog and embedded processing chips, we are problem-solvers collaborating to change the world through technology. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job This reliability engineer position is focused on development, characterization and optimization of high voltage gallium nitride (GaN) power devices. As part of TI’s analog technology development (ATD) team, the role involves close collaboration with fab/manufacturing, business units and Kilby Labs. This position requires in-depth knowledge of III-nitride materials, device physics, and reliability. Experience in development of GaN devices for normally-off operation is desired. The scope of the job includes, but not limited to: Reliability characterization, accelerated lifetime testing and modeling of GaN devices Collaboration with design and applications engineers to meet device reliability requirements GaN device simulations (TCAD), reliability test structure design & layout Collaboration with fab/manufacturing engineers to ensure device manufacturability Failure root-cause investigation for device/process/reliability/yield improvements The ideal candidate is expected to have a strong understanding of the following: Reliability statistics, characterization methodologies, and lifetime modeling High voltage power FET and other relevant analog device physics Typical analog silicon and GaN high electron mobility transistor (HEMT) process flows and the underlying process physics Electrical and materials characterization methodologies and statistical data analysis Strong hands-on lab experience and excellent problem solving skills are also needed. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must as the position requires interfacing with multiple teams. Minimum Requirements MS in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree 5 years of experience in GaN-based device reliability characterization and modeling Preferred Qualifications PhD in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree 10 years of experience in GaN-based device development Experience in normally-off GaN device development for high power switching applications Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Sound decision-making capabilities and the ability to prioritize tasks and adapt accordingly Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or age. jobTitle: Bulk Gas and CDA Technician - Facilities - 1st Shift (RFAB)
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments is looking for a skilled Facilities BGS/CDA Technician to join our team. As a BGS/CDA Facilities Technician, you will perform technical tasks in support of engineering and maintenance activities involving the construction, design, specification, startup and operation of the facility’s BGS and CDA systems. Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To Assist in commissioning of new RFAB BGS/CDA equipment Create assets, job plans, and set up PMs in FMS Coordinate equipment maintenance with contract service groups for large equipment Partner with industrial gas suppliers to ensure reliable operation of bulk gas storage and distribution equipment Drive maintenance efficiency by reviewing recommended maintenance procedures/job plans to ensure best practices are in place and documented properly. Manage CM’s, PM’s, and other work as required Respond quickly to system alarms and potentially critical situations, perform rapid and accurate situational assessments and troubleshoot BGS/CDA system components Provide technical support for 24-hour operations team; Willingness to handle onsite call-in situations after hours Drive development, implementation, and execution of programs targeted to improve quality, reliability, and operational effectiveness of systems and services Work with engineers and operations in updating and maintaining SOPs and other documentation for system Manage the system maintenance costs for system and implement cost savings projects Perform other job-related tasks as required Minimum Requirements High school diploma/GED with 5 years of relevant experience or 2 years of experience with an Associate's Degree Must have or develop the ability to diagnose process issues and to perform maintenance to BGS/CDA system components such as: Bulk Gas purifiers, regulators, control valves, filters and instrumentation. CDA compressors, dryers, control valves, filters and instrumentation. Computer/software skills – Outlook, Excel, Word, FMS, SCADA, SAP, PowerPoint, SharePoint and AutoCAD Strong organization, communication, and interpersonal skills Must work well in a team environment Be willing to put Safety and Reliability above all other factors Preferred Requirements Self-starter requiring little direction to identify and solve problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to interface professionally and effectively with all levels Excellent organizational, prioritization, and time management skills Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI has a dynamic six-month co-op program for undergraduate and graduate students looking for exciting careers for with accounting, finance, industrial engineering, operations and supply chain degrees. Our co-ops go right to work! You will be a contributor, not a trainee, as you become familiar with the company’s business systems and methods of operations. As a Texas Instruments’ Business Operations Co-Op, you will apply the skills gained through your college experiences while also gaining valuable business, technical and life skills. Co-Op opportunities are available across the spectrum of business and operations functions including accounting, finance, pricing, supply chain. Your projects may be in one or more of these areas: Accounting: Analyzing business cost trends; updating semiconductor pricing for internal transfers; understanding research and development (R&D) expenses and trends and comparing them to forecasts/estimates; and performing monthly journal entries and reconciling accounts. Finance: Developing projections for profit and loss (P&L) and balance sheet items; supporting various managers with proactive reviews of actual and projected spending; and developing analytical tools and reporting to support different financial and operational areas within the organization. Operations: Monitoring product support at key manufacturing sites; performing supply and demand analysis; analyzing supply strategy and factory optimization; and making improvements in reporting through the use of automation. Procurement and logistics: Learning and leading sourcing activities including qualifying bidders, conducting bid discussions, analyzing bid results, and awarding opportunities to key suppliers through the use of standardized process tools. Identifying, defining processes for, and deploying new systems capabilities to WPL logistics and procurement team members. Pricing: executing pricing and developing quoting strategies for assigned areas of responsibility which enable sales to achieve revenue and share growth while maximizing TI profit. We offer two co-op terms. The first term is January through June and our second term is July through December. The assignments will be located in Dallas, TX. Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Our comprehensive development program is designed to give you first-hand experience working in various roles, meaning you get to experience multiple functions and learn skillsets across communications. You’ll receive hands-on coaching and training along the way before deploying into a full-time role. This unique opportunity enables you to explore, grow, build confidence and learn what type of work motivates you. So come join us and find out why Forbes named us one of the Best Employers for New Grads. What are the details? This is a 1-year communications development program, consisting of two 6-month rotations through a variety of communications functions. You will have the opportunity to develop critical skills, such as developing a communications strategy, campaign planning, content creation and storytelling, project management and channel expertise. Beyond developing the right skills, you will be able to put those skills to the test across core communication areas, including corporate communications, creative project management, giving and volunteering, employee and executive communications and more. For example, you could create exciting content for TI’s social media channels; promote TI to recruit future employees; get hands-on experience in crisis communications; or build internal communications programs to engage employees. This role is best suited for individuals looking to become proficient in various communication skillsets, while also seeking accelerated growth through dedicated development and networking programs and a broad view of our company. Building a Strong Foundation Put your skills to work through real-world applications, with projects essential to TI’s success and the ability to make an impact from day one. Expand your network of contacts, build skills for future roles across the organization and develop a diverse TI knowledge base. Gain insights into our global organization – collaborate with team members around the globe, experience different management styles, mentors, teams and skillsets to help you determine which skills and work environment inspire you most. Experience an environment that unlocks everyone’s potential, where we treat one another with respect, value our differences, and encourage you to share your thoughts and ideas. Benefit from custom-made development and networking programs, designed to enhance your development and connect you with new college graduates, other professionals at TI and leaders around the company. Develop Powerful Skillsets Build a strong understanding of TI’s corporate, employee and leader communication strategies to ensure communication strategies and messaging are aligned. Learn concepts and strategic considerations for developing a comprehensive communications plan (internal and/or external), where you get to own the strategy, development, launch, execution of tactics and measurement of results. Develop competency in both content and channels to reach TI’s current and future employees, customers, investors, suppliers and local communities. Craft compelling, audience-centric messaging, as well as curate and distribute content in various formats and channels for internal and external audiences. As examples, this work may include blogs, videos, email copy, intranet content, presentations and more. As you grow in your knowledge of channels, you may also leverage search, paid advertising, paid aggregation, automated campaigns, social media and/or influencer relations. Problem-solve on company-wide communications projects, while planning for different scenarios, applying your personal creativity, maintaining a communication loop with stakeholders and being flexible in the event of change. And, along the way, you’ll partner with subject matter experts and develop great working relationships with TIers who live our values every day. Upon successful completion of the Communications Development Program, rotators will move into a full-time role based on demonstrated areas of excellence and role availability. Put your talent to work with us in our Communications Development Program – change the world, love your job! Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. About The Job The Compliance Project / Program Leader is responsible for collaborating with various business units and support functions and assisting with efforts to ensure the company’s compliance with applicable regulatory security requirements. The work involves participation in major projects and activities and includes assistance with data analysis and management, process and control documentation, the gathering of strategic stakeholder inputs, and other key activities. This role is a great opportunity for individuals to gain business, regulatory, and risk management expertise, develop a network of contacts across the company, and connect with colleagues in other locations. In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include Assist in the development of global security standards and procedure documentation Support the development and maintenance of an effective regulatory risk framework that includes planning, executing, and reporting results of internal security assessments across the organization. Develop audit programs to evaluate compliance, conduct audit/assessments, and write detailed reports to substantiate findings. Initiate, track, and monitor corrective action plans resulting from security assessments and other internal/external analyses and audits to ensure compliance with corporate and regulatory standards. Assist with relevant regulatory filings and compilation of pertinent documentation that must be submitted to regulatory agencies. Maintain an advanced awareness of regulatory and legislative developments and industry trends. Communicate and interact with regulatory agencies, external consultants, and internal groups. Assist in the development of compliance training materials (i.e., security awareness) in support of regulatory requirements. Assist in the development and reporting of compliance and electronic security metrics. jobTitle: Digital Design Engineer - Clock & Timing Solutions
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! Why Clock and Timing Solutions? The Clock and Timing Solutions (CTS) business is one of the fastest growing analog mixed-signal businesses within TI. We are developing leading edge Clock Generators, Clocking Buffers, Jitter Cleaners, and Network Synchronizer ICs that provide highly accurate low noise reference clocks necessary for communications, automotive applications, servers, and other systems. This is a highly visible role for a Digital Design Engineer with the passion and excitement to grow, innovate and execute on complex digital developments while take an active role in product definition with system team, and guiding the backend team on digital characterization needs through ramp to market. As a Senior Digital Designer on the Clock and Timing Solutions team you will be responsible for leading the digital partition of our solutions in coordination with the Analog Design team to control APLLs, develop DPLLs, provide digital filtering algorithms, generate serial interfaces and shadow registers, and manage interactions with various types of memory macros. Preferred Digital Design Skills Understanding of PLL concepts, experience with developing Digital PLLs Strong digital fundamentals (clock switching and gating, synchronization, serial interfaces, Lint and CDC analysis) Experience with synthesis, constraints, and timing closure Familiarity with verilog and systemVerilog for design Simulation Debug capability Minimum Requirements 7+ years of relevant experience Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field of study Preferred Qualifications A thorough understanding of digital logic design flow from spec and RTL development through PnR Familiarity with the Verilog language and simulators Good understanding of analog functionality and exposure to analog IC design methods Ability to work closely with Analog Design, Systems, and Apps teams in a coordinated effort to overcome technical challenges Ability to solve problems using a systematic approach Experience with System Verilog Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in various functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Demonstrated history of taking initiative and driving for results Verification and Validation experience a plus Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. In this position, you will be working on high-speed mixed-signal communication circuits using state-of-the art process technology, as well as be involved in the design of high performance digital circuits interfacing to leading edge analog circuitry as part of an overall system. Your responsibilities will include RTL coding, simulation, synthesis, timing closure, verification, evaluation, debugging of high-speed communication chips both at the circuit level and behavioral level. As a digital design engineer, you will prepare test methods and specifications, assist in preparation of application information, data sheets and demo boards. You will develop solutions to complex problems through assessment of various techniques and approaches. You will plan and organize work to ensure timely completion of many independent tasks with general instructions on routine tasks and with detailed instructions on new assignments. This position involves routine communication with a highly talented team of analog and digital design engineers to solve problems and present information as well as active participation in work groups, providing ideas and collaborative teamwork. jobTitle: Director of Government Relations - Dallas, Texas
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. About The Role Texas Instruments (TI) Government Relations represents the company on important public policy issues with key government decision makers, industry associations and business partners. In this role, you will advocate for TI policy priorities and gain direct exposure to business, sales and operations leaders of the company. Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To Represent TI externally with State and local elected officials and community leaders in communities where TI operates. Become a leader on policy trade association boards in Texas. Identify policy issues that impact TI and work with TI stakeholders to formulate positions on issues. Directly advocate with lawmakers, executive branch officials, regulatory agencies, industry representatives, trade associations and other external stakeholders to influence public policy in key TI issue areas – tax, energy, water, environmental, workforce, research/higher-ed, public safety. Develop strategies to advance policy objectives. Closely monitor and analyze state and local policy developments at State and local levels in order to recommend strategies and solutions. Facilitate successful fab tours and site visits in order to develop knowledge of TI manufacturing operations and the semiconductor industry. Partner with workforce development teams in order to build a network of community partners and funding opportunities to implement STEM-related and manufacturing education programs and policies. Work closely with all US GR team members to coordinate on issues. Develop and maintain strategic relationships with Texas congressional delegation, site representatives and leadership at the State and local level and key community partners. Prepare policy briefings, advocacy materials, testimony, and correspondence on legislative/regulatory actions. Promote TI's reputation and thought leadership. Position senior executives to most effectively advance TI public policy objectives. Counsel and support executives and leaders who represent TI with-in trade associations and other relevant leadership roles. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree related policy field 5+ years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications Five plus years of similar issues management in these policy areas and examples of a proven track record. Solid knowledge of State and local legislative and regulatory process. Excellent and persuasive written, oral and presentation communications skills. Can communicate effectively at all levels. Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a team environment. Self-starter, who solves problems, adapts to changing circumstances and acts with urgency. Knowledge of technology policy issues and/or semiconductor industry. Frequent travel within Texas. Quick study; ability to adapt skills and new policy challenges. Experience working with executives and elected officials; strong relationships with government leaders. High level of professionalism and discretion in handling confidential information. Why TI? This role requires you to select, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Cooperate with local authorities and drive local environmental permit management and compliance. Coordinate interpretation and application of internal and external standards and regulations to ensure compliance. Evaluate and analyze risks associated with the processes and operations used in Semiconductor manufacturing (including support systems and tasks performed on those systems). Conduct internal ESH inspection/audits and monitor the effectiveness of program implementation, and corrective/improvement plans. Review & analyze accident and incident data to identify and recommend plans to prevent recurrence. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. About The Job As a Digital Design Engineer, you’ll create Integrated Circuit Designs that help bring new TI products to life and make our customers’ visions a reality. You’ll define, design, model, implement and document analog, digital and/or RF integrated circuits (ICs). And, you’ll have the opportunity to work in exciting areas like audio, imaging, high-speed, interface, clocking, medical, high volume linear, automotive, storage, power supply, battery management, linear power and many more. You’ll help define and then design, simulate, and implement analog integrated circuits in silicon. You’ll be working on state-of-the-art wafer processes and learning from and collaborating with industry experts. Understanding the various aspects of product development will help you become a better designer. You will spend time performing typical “front-end” design activities such as designing and drawing the schematics, simulating for functionality and parametric performance, and assisting in the IC layout and then running post-layout extracted simulations. You’ll also gain exposure to other “back-end” activities such as bench characterization, final test, and failure analysis. This is a great way to apply knowledge from your circuit design coursework and see how designs progress in the real world. Put your talent to work with us as a Digital IC Design Engineer – change the world, love your job! jobTitle: Engineering Technician - Failure Analysis Lab (Dallas - North Campus)
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Texas Instruments is looking for a skilled Equipment Technician to join our team. In this role, you will perform preventative maintenance, equipment repairs, equipment improvements, equipment upgrades, and equipment installation. You will interface and communicate with engineering and manufacturing groups across the fab to ensure all issues are solved appropriately and efficiently. Job Description Responsible to perform DSIMS (Dynamic Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry) characterization of semiconductor devices. Identification of doping profile for process technology development, wafer fab manufacturing, and package technology development is a primary goal. Individual must be thorough to manage daily operation and interface with customers to drive results. Implementation of corrective actions including development of new techniques to address issues should be a huge plus. This position also offers a unique opportunity to collaborate with experts in other material characterization areas like TEM, SEM, FIB, scanning probe microscope analysis, surface analysis, and failure analysis in the lab. Primary Responsibilities Successful operation of the DSIMS equipment (Magnetic Sector and Quadrupole instruments) addressing a variety of samples from semiconductor processing including compound semiconductor. Follow all analytical procedures and specs in the lab and be familiar with instrumentation maintenance and able to troubleshoot problems if they arise and clearly communicate them to the vendor’s service engineers for fast resolution. Coordinate with engineers and customer base to address workload timely with high quality data. Interface with customers and stakeholders in order to increase the effectiveness of the operation resulting in quality outputs. Work in a team environment interfacing with customer and lab members. Minimum Requirements Associates degree in engineering or related field or equivalent military experience. 3+ Years of relevant work experience. Night shift availability is a big advantage. Semiconductor experience in a failure analysis lab is a plus. Additional experience in operation of analysis techniques (ToF-SIMS, Auger, XRD and FTIR) is a plus. Proficient knowledge of semiconductor devices and processes is a plus. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions. Ability to take the initiative and drive for results. Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery. Why TI? Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Are you looking to work in a fast paced environment where you can make a difference in the energy footprint of this world? Do you have a passion for promoting a positive environmental culture coupled with an interest in contributing directly to the bottom line? If so, this may be the position for you! Texas Instruments (TI) is currently looking for and experienced Environmental Specialist to become a member of our Audits and Compliance Team and help manage our environmental programs. Specific environmental programs include waste management, pollution prevention, wastewater disposal, solid waste disposal, water pollution control, air pollution control, hazardous substances regulation, and spill prevention and response. Responsibilities Include Helping TI sites ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and company standards; Performing compliance and conformance audits of site-level environmental programs; Providing technical assistance and guidance to sites regarding air pollution management, waste management, pollution prevention, stormwater management, industrial wastewater management, hazardous substance regulation, spill prevention and response, standards interpretations, design reviews, developing appropriate action plans associated with these activities, and support for global ESH initiatives; Leading TI’s global ESH regulatory review process, including managing third-party regulatory services and website, leading global review meetings, researching global regulatory trends. Providing leadership and support for regulatory interpretations and ESH considerations for management of change; Managing TI’s US sites Surplus Chemical Program, including identification of viable end users and contract review; Managing TI’s Toxic Substance Control Act program; Maintaining documentation systems to keep corporate and mandatory ESH rules/regulations, communication materials, inspection and audit reports to ensure that the major activities are properly documented according to needs; Mentoring and developing other ESH professionals, as well as creating and presenting training on environmental topics. The Candidate Must Be Able To Interpret a broad spectrum of issues and their associated regulations and standards, and then formulate plans and guidelines to implement corrective/preventive actions; Use logic to analyze or identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts associated with information or data; Assess and analyze environmental risks associated with semiconductor manufacturing, assembly/test, laboratory operations, as well as facilities support tasks; Apply knowledge of EPA regulations to apply cost-effective and practical compliance solutions; Evaluate TI business needs and develop compliance standards and implementation guidance based on regulations and best-known methods; Communicate clearly, concisely and effectively, both in writing and verbally; Read, interpret and apply laws, rules, regulations, policies and/or procedures; Potentially represent TI on various industry associations, working groups and committees; Deal with people in a manner which shows sensitivity, tact, impartiality, and professionalism. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Sciences, Environmental Engineering, or related field; 5 years of experience in a high-tech industry or similar environment implementing and supporting ESH programs. Preferred Qualifications Certified/Associate Hazardous Materials Management Manager; Semiconductor factory process and equipment experience; Strong knowledge of 40 CFR standards (EPA), CAA, CWA, EPCRA, RCRA, DOT: Strong documentation and organization skills; Analytical and problem-solving skills; Demonstrated strong customer service orientation and ability to take ownership for issue resolution; Strong collaboration skills with the ability to develop strong working relationships with customers and team members; Strong time management skills and ability to manage multiple projects; Ability to take the initiative and drive for results; Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced, and rapidly changing environment; Ability to obtain professional engineer license a plus; Strong SharePoint skills; Strong leadership and influencing skills.
