TI Process/Equipment Engineers are responsible for all aspects of a wafer fabrication process including tool selection and process definition. They assist with the installation, modification, upgrade and maintenance of the manufacturing equipment. This includes process setup and technician and operator training. This position will use data to make intelligent improvements to overall fabrication process and will be responsible for understanding all aspects of the process performed. This includes the interaction of the process to other fab processing, enabling accurate product dispositions of non-conforming product. Interaction normally requires the ability to gain cooperation of others and conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects/schedules. In this semiconductor fab engineer role with Texas Instruments’ worldwide manufacturing organization, you will be responsible for engineering process optimization efforts to achieve fab cycle time goals. You will interface with various modules, in addition to yield, product and integration teams, to resolve issues that limit yield performance. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. As someone fresh out of college, making an immediate impact and gaining hands on experience is probably at the top your priority list. For graduates with a Facilities or ESH related degree (Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Civil, Environmental, or Industrial Engineering degrees or Environmental Science, Occupational Health, Public Health, or other related degree), we’ve got a rotation program designed for you! This is an opportunity to develop valuable skills in a collaborative environment that will provide you direct contact with key facilities and ESH leaders across TI. Along the way you’ll receive coaching and training to help position you for a long and successful career where you’ll be inspired to innovate, collaborate and make a true impact. As a participant in FOCUS you’ll rotate through two diverse and challenging positions within Facilities during a 2-year period. Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To In this program, you’ll be immersed in meaningful assignments giving you real-world experience and sense of ownership. As a participant in FOCUS you’ll rotate through two diverse and challenging positions within ESH during a 2-year period related to your specialty or study including environmental, safety, industrial hygiene, and ergonomics. As an ESH Specialist you’ll be directly responsible for various ESH programs related to your specialty in support of a semiconductor wafer fab. These ESH programs help to ensure that TI manufacturing operations are protective of human health and the environment and meet applicable laws and regulations. Some programs may include, environmental sampling and monitoring, safety assessments, work environment monitoring, ergonomics assessments, risk assessments, regulatory review and compliances, and reporting. Managing environmental programs including storm water, wastewater treatment, air quality (including greenhouse gases), waste management, resource conservation, and contamination remediation (including groundwater) Evaluate and assess ESH risks (e.g. chemical/gas, electrical, and mechanical risks) associated with process and support equipment Work with site personnel to conduct job hazard assessments and ensure PPE and other safety requirements are incorporated Conducting ergonomics assessments and developing innovative solutions to mitigate risks Providing technical support to the Facilities and manufacturing organizations as an ESH expert over time Teaming with other engineering disciplines, management, internal customers, and suppliers to ensure projects and systems are protective of human health and the environment and meet all ESH standards and applicable laws and regulations Management of site ESH data including electronic recordkeeping, tracking systems, and databases Ensure ESH compliance with reporting and documentation requirements Respond to and provide ESH support during emergencies and drills Designing and managing turnkey projects and coordinating contract work in the field Our ESH roles are comprised of the following as a part of the FOCUS rotation program: Environmental Specialist: Responsible for environmental programs in including waste management, pollution prevention, storm water management, industrial wastewater management, air pollution control, hazardous substance regulation, and spill prevention and response. Safety Specialist: Responsible for assessing different safety aspects related to semiconductor development and production including chemical, electrical, and mechanical risks, and developing a plan or solution to mitigate the risk. Ergonomics Specialist: Evaluate and develop solutions to ergonomics risks in the work environment at TI from assessing risks in a normal office environment to very complex ergonomics risks that are unique to the semiconductor manufacturing process. Industrial Hygiene Specialist: Responsible for assessing the impact that a particular job function or work environment could have on the health and wellbeing of an employee including assessing potential physical or chemical exposure risks and methods to mitigate those exposures. Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. About The Job As a Yield Enhancement (YE) Frontline Engineer you are responsible for all aspects of daily defect monitoring and line control in RFAB's high volume semiconductor manufacturing environment. Your primary responsibility will be investigating root cause for out-of-control production material, new defect types, and abnormal spatial signatures. As such, you will be required to create, modify, and optimize inspection recipes. You must react to baseline shifts and defect excursions with a sense of urgency and partner with Fab Engineering to contain, understand, and resolve any problem that may arise while on-shift. There will be opportunities to lead, influence, and support teams associated with defect-density reduction, defect excursions, and high-impact quality events. You are required to spend time in the Fab on a daily basis working closely with the on-shift Technicians to resolve inline defect issues and communicate findings to the engineering community through daily interaction with Equipment, Process, and Product engineering counterparts. You must identify high-impact defect issues and partner with Fab Engineering to implement corrective actions. Presenting inspection data with clear conclusions to upper management is essential. You will need to create or update documentation (defect classification guide, disposition specs, etc.) on a regular basis. Benefits Working on a CWW schedule offers a great work/life balance; here are some of the benefits As RFAB continues to grow, it's imperative we identify and contain abnormal events quickly. As such, to ensure we have the best possible coverage to support factory operations, this position will be on a compressed workweek (CWW) schedule (either A- or C-Shift). You only work half the year Limits interruptions on your days off You get paid for TI holidays, in addition to your normal salary Three- and Four-day weekends allow you to take trips without using vacation days You can avoid the weekend crowds at movies, events, shopping, etc. We're looking for strong candidates to fill these important roles in RFAB. If you're looking to join a winning team and have a passion to solve problems, I encourage you to apply. Minimum Requirements Two years relevant experience Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Materials Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, or a related field Strong foundation in statistical process control, engineering change control and process release strategies Preferred Qualifications Technical leadership – Loop Team or Small Group Activities Leader, Tech Ladder (MGTS/SMTS) Data analysis proficiency – Wafer sleuth, Spotfire, mBASE, JMP, etc. Previous YE experience – Loop Ownership, inspection recipe creation, defect-density reduction Track record of effectively leading teams through high-impact quality events (process excursions) Solid understanding of semiconductor process flow/integration Key Attributes and Characteristics Puts team first and values collaboration Works effectively/efficiently with little direction High level of accountability/ownership Consistently drives to root cause Effective communicator Dependable and flexible Maintains positive attitude even with quickly shifting priorities Track record of setting and achieving high goals Likes being in the cleanroom doing hands-on work Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. Manufacturing

About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Engineer that will be responsible for the airborne molecular contamination (AMC) program worldwide. This engineer will be directly responsible worldwide working with all the manufacturing sites for their AMC programs and reports in to Worldwide Facilities (WWF). This is for both the wafer fabs and the assembly test sites. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption. The WWF team works closely with TI’s other facilities sustaining organizations and manufacturing teams to understand how the facilities utility systems impact the process quality, reliability, and safety as well as how to reduce consumption. Responsibilities & Qualifications Include Manage and maintain multiple wafer fab AMC routine programs. Manage team of skilled contractors that support the AMC analysis programs of manufacturing sites. Support TI AMC teams, wafer fabs & AT sites globally as technical lead. SME of ion mobility spectrometry, specifically Particle Measuring Systems Airsentry II. This includes analysis functions, zeroing and spanning of the instruments as well as troubleshooting. Problem solving dealing directly with wafers in process impacted by potential AMC and the ability to recommend analysis methods to identify the compound / compounds. Review and understand potential impact of products foreign to the cleanroom environment and provide knowledgeable recommendations for using or not using the product in the wafer fab along with what precautions should be taken if product is used in the fab. Provide AMC consultation as technical lead to Mfg team engineers across TI to assist in troubleshooting of process issues. Devise analysis methods and procedures for simulations or experiment based testing to solve issues in semiconductor manufacturing. Awareness of the latest instrumentation for AMC analysis with the ability to test such new instruments for potential purchase recommendations. Understanding of chemicals and gases utilized in the manufacturer of semiconductors and their reactions and decomposition potentials to produce harmful AMC byproducts. Understanding of Auger, EDX, XPS, STM and other various industry standard lab analysis methods. Knowledge of the following analytical methods & the ability to interpret results: ToF-SIMS, Impingers, chromatography, thermal desorption by GS/MS, and cavity ring down spectrometry analysis method. Good communication & teamwork skills. Strong troubleshooting skills. Ability to train others Lead teams without managing. Ability to respond after hours. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering; or equivalent engineering experience. 5 years or more experience with Semiconductor Facilities and/or mechanical systems experience such as designing, maintaining, or installing distribution piping, duct work, HVAC, chillers, pumping systems, exhaust system, and/or process related systems If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. The RFAB Facilities team is looking for an experienced Mechanical or Chemical Engineer focusing on Bulk Gas and Compressed Air systems. This person will provide engineering ownership of building utility systems in support of a semiconductor wafer fab. Facilities operates over 150 different utility systems that include chemicals, gasses, variety of electrical systems, water systems, HVAC, waste, vacuum, and controls. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state of the art manufacturing environment. Facilities works closely with TI’s manufacturing team to understand how the utility systems impact the process as well as how to reduce consumption. Responsibilities Include Technical focus, capacity management, problem solving, root cause analysis, engineering design, cost estimating, financial management, project management, and system documentation. Work to integrate reliability focus and risk analysis into Systems Engineering job scope. This includes FMEA'S, root cause analysis, design, commissioning and training. Develop and review operations and maintenance procedures/programs with team to ensure use of best practices. Be available to Operations during and after normal business hours if there are technical issues on systems. Influence Supplier Performance via management and audits of work performed in the field. Forecast system capacity needs based on current and future demand projections. Develop plans to accommodate projected system demand needs. Organize and plan mechanical systems design activities, generate construction documents and provide project management oversight in conjunction with other design disciplines. Ensure projects and systems are compliant with applicable codes, cost effective and meet the desired design criteria while adhering to budget and schedule guidelines. Forecast associated costs and manage expenditures for new construction and/or sustaining operations and report deviations to management. Innovate and implement cost reduction projects that reduce operating and maintenance cost of responsible systems. Develop relationships and communicate with engineers and personnel at other TI sites to foster best practice sharing and communication. Successfully interface with customer organizations and maintain effective communication. Participate in corporate initiatives as required like Process System Teams and strategic focus teams Act as system owner for bulk gases as well as compressed air systems supporting manufacturing and administrative spaces in RFAB. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering 3-5 years experience Preferred Qualifications Self-motivated, flexible, and able to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Excellent time management and priority-setting skills; ability to effectively advance multiple activities concurrently. Demonstrates leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Experience with bulk gases and compressed air systems similar to those used in the semiconductor industry Experience with industrial facilities Experience with installation, construction, and management of capital projects Certifications or training with specific bulk gas or compressed air systems infrastructure is a plus Collaborative and customer-focused approach. Strong analytical skills for assessing problems, and developing corrective and preventive actions. Ability to interface professionally and effectively with all levels of management; excellent people skills including leadership and influencing others. About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Chemical and Gas Engineer to join our World-Wide Facilities (WWF) Team. This engineer will be directly responsible for sustaining, design, installation and project management for chemical and gas systems to support a semiconductor wafer fab in North Texas. TI Facilities operates a variety of process and support chemical, gas, and high purity water systems. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. The WWF team works closely with TI’s other facilities sustaining organizations and manufacturing teams to understand how the facilities utility systems impact the process quality, reliability, and safety as well as how to reduce consumption. Sustaining: Chemical/Gas Systems may include: High purity acids/bases/solvents, distributed as either pumped or gas pressured Ultra-pure gases including inert, flammable, corrosive, pyrophoric Dispense equipment - Chemical Distribution Units, Valve Manifold Boxes, Gas Cabinets, Bulk Containers, Cryogenic Tanks, Gas Purifiers De-ionized Water/Ultrapure Water Systems may include: High purity water treatment for use in manufacturing Process equipment including carbon beds, membranes, reverse osmosis, ultraviolet sterilization, ion exchange, ultrafiltration Working knowledge of system components such as: distribution piping; diaphragm, magnetically driven/levitated, and pneumatic pumps; chemical and gas filters Provide engineering support for system operations & maintenance, review system capacity vs. demand and assist with system troubleshooting Knowledge of chemical compatibility for materials for process fluids and gases, as well as materials of construction needed for chemical, gas, and water systems to meet semiconductor high purity requirements and all code compliance requirements (IFC, IBC, NFPA, PSM/RMP etc.) Collaborate with Operations and Maintenance team to develop plans for maximizing operational and maintenance efficiency Perform systems assessments, develop and implement improvement roadmap via capital and expense projects Effectively manage system deliverables including points of delivery, utility parameters, alarm and warning setpoints, specification limits and notification methods Development and maintenance of Piping and instrumentation diagrams, process flow diagrams, standard operating procedures, sequence of operations for respective systems spell out acronyms as well Work to integrate reliability focus and risk analysis into Systems Engineering job scope. This includes FMEAs, root cause analysis, design, commissioning and training. Project Management: Coordinate with other engineering disciplines, management, internal customers, business partners, contractors and suppliers to ensure projects and systems are cost effective, within budget, meet the desired design criteria and schedule requirements. Responsible for the engineering analysis, design, and installation oversight of distribution systems for chemicals and gas equipment and systems. Project scopes will range from the installation of a single valve manifold box (VMB) up to the design and installation of a bulk-fed factory-wide distribution system. Review construction management documentation such as submittals and requests for information. Manage all project related financial information to ensure compliance to budget, including change notices, purchase orders, capital forecasts and invoicing. Direct and execute project commissioning to ensure all chemical and gas systems equipment, components and infrastructure perform as designed. Organize and plan design activities, create construction documents or manage external design teams in the execution of such deliverables. Write scopes of work, bid request for proposals, specify and order material. Complete projects safely and reliably with zero impact to customer manufacturing operations. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above in related field of study 3 years or more experience with Semiconductor Facilities and/or Chemical and Gas experience designing, maintaining, or installing distribution piping, valve manifold boxes, gas cabinets, chemical supply pumping systems, hazardous and high purity chemicals and gases, or de-ionized / ultrapure water systems Preferred Qualifications Self-motivated, flexible, and able to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Excellent time management and priority-setting skills; ability to effectively advance multiple activities concurrently. Demonstrates leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Experience with gases and chemicals used in the semiconductor industry Experience with industrial facilities Experience with installation, construction, and management of capital projects Certifications or training with specific semiconductor chemical and gas systems infrastructure is a plus Collaborative and customer-focused approach. Strong analytical skills for assessing problems, and developing corrective and preventive actions. Ability to interface professionally and effectively with all levels of management; excellent people skills including leadership and influencing others. Candidate must demonstrate strong safety leadership Proficiency with Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, AutoCAD and similar software. Keywords for recruiter to use: chemical, gas, deionized water, ultra-pure water, high purity, chemical distribution, bulk chemical, bulk gas, project management, Facilities, process engineer Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Controls Engineer to join our World-Wide Facilities (WWF) Team. This engineer will be directly responsible for sustaining, design and installation of controls, life safety and electronic access systems to support a semiconductor wafer fab in North Texas. TI Facilities operates a variety of controls systems. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. The WWF team works closely with TI’s other facilities sustaining organizations and manufacturing teams to understand how the facilities utility systems impact the process quality, reliability, and safety as well as how to reduce consumption. Job Description Facilities Sustaining Controls Engineering responsibilities: Controls system management including PLC (programmable logic controller), SCADA (supervisory control and data acquisition), Facilities network, SCADA servers and process related temperature/humidity/pressure transmitters and flow meters etc. PLC and SCADA program, trouble shooting. Collaborate with IT to maintain the servers and network. SFC (Statistical Factory Control) chart establish and publish to website for related engineers review. Collaborate with related system engineers and operations to optimize alarm descriptions, priority and etc. Work out and execute the controls project roadmap. Systems assessment and improvement roadmap establishment and implementation Capital and expense projects execution in support of safety, reliability, quality, environmental and cost objective. Ensure facilities controls systems are operating reliably. Overlooking projects to meet design criteria, scope, budget and schedule. Manage technical, administrative, financial, schedule aspects, strategic communications, and customer stakeholder relationships during the execution of various facilities projects. Provide and support Technician and Operator training Manage all Life Safety System gas sensor maintenance to include installation, repair, periodic checks, and required records Design, specify and purchase equipment, and manage finances for controls/LSS projects Respond quickly to system alarms and potentially critical situations, perform rapid and accurate situational assessments and troubleshoot system components Manage CM’s, PM’s, Event Manager Tasks, and other work as required Ensure all work complies with TI ESH and applicable codes and standards, including but not limited to work permits, building permits, confined space permits, and burn permits Write a scope of work for bidding by a controls contractor and manage contractors Develop and maintain SOP’s and SOO’s for systems that you own If opportunity arises, support major construction project as Controls Scope Owner with the following project management responsibilities: Coordinate with contractors, suppliers, and TI sustaining team(s) to complete controls scope for major project to meet safety, cost and schedule goals Controls systems include: Industrial controls and instrumentation Fire alarm systems Public address systems Life safety systems (gas/chemical detection) Electrical power monitoring and controls SCADA and interconnected industrial LAN network Access control systems CCTV systems Co-work with another controls engineer to split controls scope and back each other up when necessary Direct and execute project commissioning to ensure all controls and life safety software, systems, equipment, components and infrastructure perform as designed Minimum Requirements Bachelor degree or above in industrial controls, automation or equivalent engineering background; 5 years or more experience with Semiconductor Facilities Controls Systems including PLCs and monitoring systems PLC programming experience required Preferred Skills & Qualifications Thorough understanding of PID loop tuning, Ladder/block programming, Trend Charts, Hardware Communication Concepts Basic knowledge of mechanical systems operations and able to learn system operations and SCADA Strong understanding on types of instruments used at TI. DI, DO, AI, AO. Temperature, humidity, pressure, flow, RTD, transmitters; solenoid, modulating, electronic, pneumatic Familiarity with the following: PLC programming languages and common PLC hardware platforms Life Safety Systems, gas detection technologies, and fire alarm systems Ability to coordinate multiple design disciplines on a variety of projects Communicates effectively verbally and written Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills Independent, self-motivated and ambitious of unquestionable personal professional integrity Demonstrates leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Proficient to Microsoft office software include Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and AutoCAD. Self-starter with the ability to take the initiative and drive for results Candidate must demonstrate strong safety leadership Why TI? Engineer your future. jobTitle: Facilities Electrical Engineer - High Voltage Systems
jobDescription: About The Job The Facilities team has a need for an Electrical Engineer experienced in power distribution systems and high voltage systems. This person will collaborate and integrate with the existing team to facilitate electrical design, construction, and sustaining efforts. Primary Responsibilities Manage work on electrical systems, ensuring that all changes are properly documented, meet applicable codes, and all work is conducted in a safe and interruption free manner. Responsibilities include overall system design, performance monitoring, project management, implementation/commissioning, procedure development inclusive of hot work and switching order approvals, training, problem solving, cost estimating, and system documentation. Respond quickly to system alarms and potentially critical situations, perform rapid and accurate situational assessments and troubleshoot system components; root cause analysis and follow-up Perform other job-related tasks as required. Minimum Requirements 15+ years’ relevant experience Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field of study Preferred Qualifications Specific experience, knowledge and skills (current proficiency is required): Current and relevant knowledge of low, medium, and high voltage electrical gear and distribution systems Capable of reviewing and creating and executing switching orders inclusive of HV transformers, substations and distibution systems . Capable of performing switching on energized circuits up to category 3 PPE required at a minimum and ability to satisfy role of safety backup if needed. Relevant understanding of arc flash requirements, calculations and labeling. Relevant understanding of specification and usage of power monitoring devices including but not limited to Pqube, Power Quality Meters and data loggers, as well as HRG. Self-starter with the ability to take initiative, drive for results, and demonstrate ability to build strong, influential relationships. Ability to analyze existing systems and associated monitoring equipment to troubleshoot and resolve problems. Ability to develop and update process and instrumentation diagrams, sequence of operations, panel schedules and ESM. Project Management skills (strong ability to identify, prioritize, plan, execute, and follow up on numerous assignments in a dynamic environment). Computer/software skills – Outlook, Excel, Word, SAP Specific experience, knowledge and skills (current proficiency is preferred): Excellent facilitation, collaboration, and communication skills necessary to interface effectively with business partners, external suppliers, direct reports and team members (local and international). Basic financial management acumen. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. Facilities

We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Texas Instruments is looking for a skilled Facilities Technician to join our team. As a Facilities Technician, you will perform technical tasks in support of engineering and maintenance activities involving the construction, design, specification, startup and operation of the facility’s mechanical, chemical and electrical systems or the installation of semiconductor manufacturing tools. About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Mechanical Technician to join the Worldwide Facilities Team. TI Facilities operates over 150 different utility systems that include chemicals, gasses, variety of electrical systems, water systems, HVAC, waste, vacuum, and controls. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. Facilities works closely with TI’s manufacturing team to understand how the utility systems impact the process as well as seeking innovative ways on how to reduce consumption. As a Facilities Mechanical Technician, you'll be responsible for day to day system performance, maintenance, troubleshooting, repair, and documentation on designated mechanical systems in support of semiconductor manufacturing operations. You will be responsible to self-perform repair and maintenance work as well as oversee and direct contractors performing work on systems. Your responsibilities will include managing contractors & vendors to direct their daily work as well as issue POs and receive invoices. As a Mechanical Technician your responsibilities will include field work as described above and desk / computer work up to as much as 50% of a typical workday. Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Respond quickly to system alarms and potentially critical situations, perform rapid and accurate situational assessments and troubleshoot system components Identify causes of failures, determine appropriate corrective actions, and implement these corrections promptly to mitigate the effects of system upsets Drive maintenance efficiency by reviewing and documenting recommended maintenance procedures/job plans to ensure best practices are in place and documented properly. Manage corrective & preventive maintenance on mechanical equipment, including entering data and managing work orders in the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS). Understanding of mechanical systems operations and able to learn system operations and SCADA; some of the associated systems but not limited to HVAC, exhaust, chilled water, steam, hot water, process cooling water, plant vacuum, compressed air, etc. Ability to read and understand mechanical and controls system drawings. Work with engineers in updating and maintaining procedures and other documentation for their system Assist in the development, implementation of cost savings projects and execution of programs targeted to improve quality, reliability and operational effectiveness of systems and services Ensure all work complies with TI ESH and applicable codes and standards, including but not limited to work permits, building permits, confined space permits, burn permits, etc. Provide onsite technical and call-in support for the 24-hour operations team Acquire quotes and enter purchase requisitions, track and manage invoicing for work on their systems Oversee contractors performing repair and maintenance work and vendors providing materials and equipment Perform other job-related tasks as required Minimum Requirements High school diploma/GED with 5+ years of relevant experience or 3+ years of experience with an Associate's Degree. Strong understanding of Facilities Mechanical and Industrial Systems Strong computer/software skills – Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Web Based Programs, SharePoint Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. Demonstrated leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Self-starter requiring little direction to identify and solve problems. Driver of continuous improvement Extensive knowledge of rotating equipment (alignment, rebuilds, etc.) Ability to support initiatives around ESH, system reliability, and cost reduction Must be team oriented and highly collaborative, possess effective oral and written communication skills, and be extremely reliable and dependable Must be able to effectively interface with various engineering disciplines, technicians, contractors, and management Ability to create and follow detailed procedures for routine and non-routine work Ability to follow facility specified Safety and Reliability processes Computer/software skills – Outlook, Excel, Word, SCADA, SAP Why TI? About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Ultrapure Water (UPW) Engineer to join our World-Wide Facilities (WWF) Team. This engineer will be directly responsible for sustaining, design, installation and project management of process UPW systems to support a semiconductor wafer fab in North Texas. TI Facilities operates a variety of process UPW systems. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. The WWF team works closely with TI’s other facilities sustaining organizations and manufacturing teams to understand how the facilities utility systems impact the process quality, reliability, and safety as well as how to reduce consumption. Responsibilities Include Sustaining: Ensure safe, reliable, efficient operation of systems and capacity before manufacturing demand Sustaining engineering support for UPW System operations & maintenance, ownership of System capacity vs. demand and system Troubleshooting System assessment and improvement roadmap establishment and implementation Coordinate with contractors, suppliers, and TI sustaining team(s) to complete UPW scope to meet safety, cost and schedule goals Hydraulic and pneumatic system calculations and flow modeling Knowledge of chemical compatibility for materials for process fluids; as well as materials of construction needed for UPW systems to meet semiconductor high purity requirements Interface with site leadership to comprehend growth plans and process changes, capital planning to accommodate expansion, reliability improvements, and efficiency enhancements Protect TI through ownership of environmental compliance of worldwide wastewater systems Systems include: ULTRAPURE Water Pretreatment, primary and polish systems and distribution Hot UPW polish systems and distribution CMP DI (deionized) Water distribution Provide Facilities system engineering leadership to the site organizations in support of safety, reliability, quality, environmental and cost objectives. Collaborate with operations and maintenance team to develop plans for maximizing operational and maintenance efficiency. Develop system assessments and improvement roadmaps. Manage technical, administrative, financial, schedule aspects, strategic communications, and customer stakeholder relationships during the execution of various facilities projects. Permitting and Code compliance related to UPW Systems and associated infrastructure Effectively manage system deliverables including points of delivery, utility parameters, specification limits and notification methods. Develop and maintain SOP’s and SOO’s for systems that you own and identify systems requiring operating procedures and assist operations team in development and training. Work to integrate reliability focus and risk analysis into Systems Engineering job scope. This includes FMEAs, root cause analysis, cause mapping, design, commissioning and training. Complete sustaining system activities and projects safely and reliably with no disruption to customer operations Successfully communicate with multiple organizations and maintain customer focus Project Management: Responsible for the engineering analysis, design, and installation oversight of distribution and collection systems for UPW. Plan, develop and implement projects that are required for improvement, growth or rearrangement of existing systems Oversee projects to meet design criteria, scope, budget and schedule Direct and execute project commissioning to ensure all UPW systems equipment, components and infrastructure perform as designed Organize and plan design activities, create construction documents or manage external design teams in the development of those documents. jobTitle: Facilities Ultrapure Water - Industrial Waste Water Engineer
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Ultrapure Water (UPW) and Industrial Waste Water (IWW) Engineer to join our World-Wide Facilities (WWF) Team. This engineer will be directly responsible for sustaining, design, installation and project management of process UPW and IWW systems to support a semiconductor wafer fab in North Texas. TI Facilities operates a variety of process UPW and IWW systems. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. The WWF team works closely with TI’s other facilities sustaining organizations and manufacturing teams to understand how the facilities utility systems impact the process quality, reliability, and safety as well as how to reduce consumption. Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To Sustaining: Ensure safe, reliable, efficient operation of systems and capacity before manufacturing demand Sustaining engineering support for UPW and IWW System operations & maintenance, ownership of System capacity vs. demand and system Troubleshooting System assessment and improvement roadmap establishment and implementation Coordinate with contractors, suppliers, and TI sustaining team(s) to complete UPW and IWW scope to meet safety, cost and schedule goals Hydraulic and pneumatic system calculations and flow modeling Knowledge of chemical compatibility for materials for process fluids; as well as materials of construction needed for UPW and IWW systems to meet semiconductor high purity requirements Interface with site leadership to comprehend growth plans and process changes, capital planning to accommodate expansion, reliability improvements, and efficiency enhancements Protect TI through ownership of environmental compliance of worldwide wastewater systems Systems include: ULTRAPURE Water Pretreatment, primary and polish systems and distribution Hot UPW polish systems and distribution CMP DI (deionized) Water distribution IWW Waste drain collection distribution Neutralization Waste chemical drain distribution and collection General Plumbing System Potable and non-potable water systems Storm/Roof and Sanitary Drainage Condensate drainage Provide Facilities system engineering leadership to the site organizations in support of safety, reliability, quality, environmental and cost objectives. Collaborate with operations and maintenance team to develop plans for maximizing operational and maintenance efficiency. Develop system assessments and improvement roadmaps. Manage technical, administrative, financial, schedule aspects, strategic communications, and customer stakeholder relationships during the execution of various facilities projects. Permitting and Code compliance related to UPW and IWW Systems and associated infrastructure Effectively manage system deliverables including points of delivery, utility parameters, specification limits and notification methods. Develop and maintain SOP’s and SOO’s for systems that you own and identify systems requiring operating procedures and assist operations team in development and training. Work to integrate reliability focus and risk analysis into Systems Engineering job scope. This includes FMEAs, root cause analysis, cause mapping, design, commissioning and training. Complete sustaining system activities and projects safely and reliably with no disruption to customer operations Successfully communicate with multiple organizations and maintain customer focus Project Management: Responsible for the engineering analysis, design, and installation oversight of distribution and collection systems for UPW and IWW. Plan, develop and implement projects that are required for improvement, growth or rearrangement of existing systems Oversee projects to meet design criteria, scope, budget and schedule Direct and execute project commissioning to ensure all UPW and IWW systems equipment, components and infrastructure perform as designed Organize and plan design activities, create construction documents or manage external design teams in the development of those documents. Manage project and equipment installations, including project resources, schedules, and budgets Team with other engineering disciplines, management, internal customers, and suppliers to ensure projects and systems are cost effective, within budget, meet the desired design criteria and schedule guidelines Create and communicate project documentation including sequence of operations, installation procedures, and checklists for commissioning and start-up Write scopes of work, bid request for proposals, specify and order material Ensure projects and systems are compliant with applicable codes, cost effective, and meet the desired design criteria while adhering to budget and schedule guidelines Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or above in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering; or equivalent engineering experience 5 years or more experience with Semiconductor Facilities UPW and IWW Systems Experience designing, maintaining, or installation of distribution piping, unit process equipment, chemical treatment systems for UPW and IWW applications Experience and understanding of safety and environmental requirements for hazardous materials and the compatibility of materials of construction Experience with managing projects in design and construction Preferred Qualifications Self-motivated, flexible, and have ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment Possess a collaborative and customer-focused approach Commitment to a safe, reliable, and efficient work environment Strong analytical skills for assessing problems and developing corrective actions Excellent time management and priority-setting skills; ability to effectively advance multiple activities concurrently Ability to interface professionally and effectively with all levels of management Excellent people skills including leadership and influencing others Excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-starter with the ability to take the initiative and drive for results Ability to work on multiple projects and meet their multiple deadlines Use Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, AutoCAD and similar software Detailed understanding of principles and chemical/mechanical UPW and IWW unit process steps for effective treatment to support semiconductor wafer fab manufacturing. Experience with latest technology unit processes for preparation of UPW and treatment of IWW systems for the semiconductor industry Experience with industrial facilities Experience with installation, construction, and management of capital projects Certifications or training with specific semiconductor UPW and IWW infrastructure is a plus Demonstrates leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Candidate must demonstrate strong safety leadership Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. jobTitle: FAST Rotation Program - Field Applications Engineer Track - Bellevue, WA
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales. The Track Includes Two 6-month Rotations* This 12-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams. Rotation 1 - Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges. Rotation 2 - Systems Engineering & Marketing (SEM): The SEM rotation provides hands-on experiences that help future FAEs understand how various TI components fit together to provide systems-level solutions for customer designs. This rotation focuses on technical product selection, schematic/layout capture, PCB layouts, fabrication processes, board bring up and validation. Upon successful completion of the Field Applications Engineer track, rotators are welcomed as FAEs on TI’s Worldwide Sales & Applications team. After the program this position will be located at our Field Sales Office in Bellevue, WA. FAE Responsibilities Include Using various sales tools and relationships with design engineering to identify all potential projects Providing customers with proactive proposals for complete, system-level solutions that maximize TI content Using broad technical expertise to influence customers’ part selection process while favorably positioning TI versus competition Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirments Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA or higher Basic understanding of schematics, layouts and digital components Knowledge and understanding of analog circuitry (examples include: op-amps, DC/DC power, data converters, sensing, etc.) Preferred Qualifications Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills Programming skills in C/C++ (LabView recommended) Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to build lasting, influential relationships, both inside and outside the organization Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment Ability to take initiative and drive for results Ability to influence decisions through a sense of urgency and competitive drive Why TI? Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics. We’re different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Rotation 1 - Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges. Rotation 2 - Systems Engineering & Marketing (SEM): The SEM rotation provides hands-on experiences that help future FAEs understand how various TI components fit together to provide systems-level solutions for customer designs. This rotation focuses on technical product selection, schematic/layout capture, PCB layouts, fabrication processes, board bring up and validation. Upon successful completion of the Field Applications Engineer track, rotators are welcomed as FAEs on TI’s Worldwide Sales & Applications team. After the program this position will be located at our Field Sales Office in Southfield, MI. FAE Responsibilities Include Using various sales tools and relationships with design engineering to identify all potential projects Providing customers with proactive proposals for complete, system-level solutions that maximize TI content Using broad technical expertise to influence customers’ part selection process while favorably positioning TI versus competition Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirments Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA or higher Basic understanding of schematics, layouts and digital components Knowledge and understanding of analog circuitry (examples include: op-amps, DC/DC power, data converters, sensing, etc.) Preferred Qualifications Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills Programming skills in C/C++ (LabView recommended) Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to build lasting, influential relationships, both inside and outside the organization Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment Ability to take initiative and drive for results Ability to influence decisions through a sense of urgency and competitive drive Why TI? Since the weather is pleasant year-round, you’ll often find employees eating lunch outside by the pond, playing volleyball or walking around the lush campus. Our proximity to the Caltrain station makes it easy to jump on the train to go to San Jose or San Francisco. Outside of work, our employees enjoy the many outdoor activities within close proximity to the Bay Area such as hiking, backpacking, camping, skiing, surfing, boating, kayaking, mountain biking, whitewater rafting, etc. You can head up to Napa and Sonoma to explore wine country. You can head south and ATV on the beach. There are loads of breweries, bars, and incredible restaurants, both in San Francisco, San Jose, and the smaller cities in between. There are almost too many options. As an added bonus, you almost never have to worry about the weather, because it only rains for a few months in the wintertime. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job We're searching for a dynamic Analog Field Applications engineer to work with an array of customers across end equipment ranging from Automotive, Video, Communications, to Industrial and work with them solving complex problems on a daily basis. The Field Application Engineer (FAE) position is an outstanding opportunity that allows technically minded engineers to broaden their system engineering skills and application knowledge, while gaining Sales and Marketing experience. This position offers a vibrant and dynamic team-oriented work environment with exposure to a variety of state-of-the art applications each day. Texas Instruments has an exciting opportunity for an Engineering Program Manager to join our Gallium Nitride (GaN) Product Line in the High Voltage Power Business Unit in Analog Power Products. GaN is a wide-bandgap semiconductor technology which offers the potential to revolutionize the power semiconductor market by enabling significantly higher power density than existing silicon-based alternatives. The GaN team is competing in a fast-growing market against established competitors & emerging start-ups to be the #1 GaN power supplier. As Engineering Program Manager, you are accountable for overall project execution for the GaN organization and lead a team of program managers, who are in turn responsible for leading cross-functional development projects to release new GaN semiconductor products to market. The manager is responsible for the organization's capability to simultaneously execute multiple complex, cross-functional engineering projects, and to enhance product development success rate (releasing projects on-time and reducing project cycle time). In this role you may represent the company with customers on technical matters. This job has people management responsibilities. As a people leader, you will also be expected to set goals, provide feedback on performance, and drive change on your teams through coaching and developing talent. In This Role, Your Main Challenges Will Be Planning & executing new product development projects to broaden TI’s GaN portfolio. Working with our partners in TI’s Technology & Manufacturing Group to improve our GaN process and ramp up our production capacity to support demand. Driving continuous improvement in our New Product Development execution process GaN is an exciting business that is driving significant innovation for our customers & offers huge growth potential for TI. As with any new technology, we have significant challenges to go and solve. If you’re looking for a fast-paced, challenging role which will have an impact on TI for the long-term then this position as Engineering Program Manager for GaN may be right for you! About The Job The GaN Process Development Engineer is responsible for direct hands-on development of GaN unit processes and integration to support volume production of power electronics products as part of the Analog Technology Development Group. Responsibilities Include Development of robust, low cost, manufacturable GaN unit processes and/or integration of such unit processes in support of power technology products Direct hands-on process development in the fab from conception to qualification including unit process definition/requirements, recipe development, materials/process characterization, metrology requirements and process control setup, operational and manufacturing specifications/documents, coordination of factory automation setup, and training materials creation Development of process flow/integration requirements and specifications as required to meet electrical/process requirements Design of experiments and statistical analysis of data Direct engagement with material and equipment suppliers Keeping up with latest understanding of wide-band gap materials fundamentals and improvements and ensuring competitiveness Electrical/device output correlation/analysis to process/material input analysis and understanding to drive device performance/reliability and robustness improvements Process/material output to equipment/tool input analysis and understanding to drive manufacturability and robustness improvements Work with multiple equipment, process, integration, component, reliability, and test and product engineers to achieve these goals The person performing this role must be capable to plan effectively, drive schedules, meet critical deadlines on multiple tasks in parallel, lead technical discussions in their area of expertise, and work effectively across organizational boundaries. They must be able to clearly communicate project status and actions. Additionally, they must be able to interface with multiple organizations and work well on a diverse team to accomplish goals. Minimum Requirements Masters or PhD in Physics, Materials Science, EE, ChemE, or Chemistry 2-5 years of experience working on Semiconductor process development in either unit process development or integration Strong Knowledge/understanding of Semiconductor and related Materials and Characterization/analysis of such materials Knowledge/understanding of Semiconductor Manufacturing and Processes Knowledge of Semiconductor Device physics Demonstrated strong data analytical and problem solving skills including knowledge/understanding of statistical design of experiments Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of III-V HEMT Device physics, materials, and processing Knowledge/experience in Epitaxial growth (Si or III-V) Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job This process integration engineer position is focused on development, characterization and optimization of high voltage gallium nitride (GaN) power devices. As part of TI’s analog technology development (ATD) team, the role involves close collaboration with fab/manufacturing, business units and Kilby Labs. This position requires in-depth knowledge of III-nitride materials, device physics, and reliability. Experience in development of GaN devices for normally-off operation is desired. The scope of the job includes, but not limited to: GaN device simulations (TCAD), device design, layout Fabrication flow development and characterization of GaN devices Collaboration with fab/manufacturing engineers to ensure device manufacturability Collaboration with reliability engineers to meet device reliability requirements Failure root-cause investigation for device/process/reliability/yield improvements The ideal candidate is expected to have a strong understanding of the following High voltage power FETs and other relevant semiconductor device physics Typical analog silicon and GaN high electron mobility transistor (HEMT) process flows and the underlying process physics Electrical and materials characterization methodologies and statistical data analysis Strong hands-on lab experience and excellent problem solving skills are also needed. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must as the position requires interfacing with multiple teams. Minimum Requirements Masters in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree 5 years of experience working on GaN-based electronic device development Preferred Qualifications PhD in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree 10 years of experience in GaN-based electronic device development Experience in normally-off GaN device development for high power switching applications Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Sound decision-making capabilities and the ability to prioritize tasks and adapt accordingly Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. The Texas Instruments (TI) Government Relations team represents the company on important public policy issues around the world, before Congress and the Administration, and state governments across the country. In this program, you’ll be immersed in job assignments from the start in positions that are critical to our business success. international modifications for state returns such as FDII and GILTI, and managing domestic inputs and consolidated return tie-outs in the tax compliance software Assist with the federal and state quarterly estimated payment, extension and provision processes Prepare complex consolidated, combined, water’s-edge and separate state income tax returns, including adjustments decoupled from federal income tax as well as incorporate state tax law changes Work with multiple internal stake holders across different functions and levels within the organization, as well as external stakeholders to provide tax inputs on business processes and gather information needed for tax reporting Research tax technical issues and communicate the federal and/or state implications for TI tax compliance in a clear and concise manner Participate in various tax planning activities including estimated tax forecasts and other projects with a high degree of complexity that contribute to TI shareholder value Provide tax data analytics for TI management Identify and lead process improvement initiatives that streamline and influence TI-level processes within the tax function Assist with special projects as required Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field required 5+ years of related work experience Preferred Qualifications CPA and/or Master’s degree in Taxation or Accounting Large multinational company experience; early Big 4 firm experience In depth knowledge of federal and state tax laws, regulations and reporting requirements Experience with federal and state corporation tax returns Aptitude for technology, proven experience with process improvements Ability to take initiative and work independently and effectively under pressure and manage deadlines Teaming and consensus building are critical. Must successfully interface with all levels of management across a broad range of functional disciplines Excellent systems skills required - knowledge of income tax software tools such as ONESOURCE software suite and/or CORPTAX, and RIA Checkpoint are required. In the role of Layout Designer, primary activities will include: cell/top-level floor-planning, layout and verification in a Cadence Virtuoso design environment. Candidates must have analog layout experience with proficiency in analog precision circuits layout (precision references, A/D, precision oscillators) and high voltage analog layout in advanced CMOS processes. They must also know layout optimization techniques necessary for meeting device matching, placement and routing constraints. Layout area and schedule estimation are also a key part of the overall responsibilities for this position. Layout designer will be responsible to make sure that chip/block level layouts meets all design, mask & fab manufacturing requirements. Basic Requirements Experienced in precision analog layout design, floor-planning, area estimation and cell/top-level routing. Interfaces with Design Engineers to provide feedback and implement enhancements to ensure design correctness and robustness and uncover risks. Proficient in device matching techniques – such as interdigitation, common-centroid etc., minimizing parasitic, RF shielding, high frequency routing, electromigration, and cross capacitance. Strong understanding of schematic-driven layout constraints related to device matching, placement & routing Fluent in cell/top-level verification such as DRC, LVS & QRC in a Cadence Virtuoso design environment Proficient in leading top-level layout and coordinating, scheduling, and advising project layout resources to resolve technical problems and meet project schedules and communicate regular status updates. Experienced in layout area & schedule estimation Evaluation of the die size and bump/pad location at the beginning of the project and release of the final ARC/pad locations to the customer/ARM website Block and top-level power, GND and critical signal routing, power plot review and verification Able to support the PG process including MEBES review and release to mask shop Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirements Associates Degree 7+ years of layout experience Preferred Requirements Familiar with HV (high voltage) layout requirements, device construction & routing constraints Experienced in LBC8LV, LBC8LV-Iso & LBC9 processes Strong understanding of basic electrical properties and principals Strong familiarity with Cadence Virtuoso Layout XL/GXL, and Unix Familiarity with VXL flow Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Do you want to work for an organization that values your opinion? Do you want to work for an organization where you can play a pivotal role in several different areas? As a Texas Instruments Manufacturing Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a vibrant and dynamic team-oriented environment. TI’s Manufacturing Engineers are technical leaders who get to work in the world’s most advanced manufacturing facilities. We bring the company’s breakthrough innovations to life by manufacturing technologies that are literally changing the world. TI Process/Equipment Engineers are responsible for all aspects of a wafer fabrication process including tool selection and process definition. They assist with the installation, modification, upgrade and maintenance of the manufacturing equipment. This includes process setup and technician and operator training. This position will use data to make intelligent improvements to overall fabrication process and will be responsible for understanding all aspects of the process performed. This includes the interaction of the process to other fab processing, enabling accurate product dispositions of non-conforming product. Interaction normally requires the ability to gain cooperation of others and conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects/schedules. Aa Manufacturing Product Engineer, you will interface with design, process, test, reliability and manufacturing engineering to solve product issues and production problems, as well as developing process improvements to reduce production costs and increase yields. Manufacturing Product Engineers also manage new product introduction and production support engineering for a specific product or group of products after they have been transferred from design to in-house or outsourced production. In this semiconductor fab engineer role with TI’s worldwide manufacturing organization, you will be responsible for engineering process optimization efforts to achieve fab cycle time goals. You will interface with various modules, in addition to yield, product and integration teams, to resolve issues that limit yield performance. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Manufacturing engineering, Manufacturing systems engineering, Mechanical engineering technology, Microelectronic engineering, Semiconductor degrees program, Electrical systems engineering technology Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA, or higher Preferred Qualifications Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. As a Texas Instruments Manufacturing Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a vibrant and dynamic team-oriented environment. TI’s Manufacturing Engineers are technical leaders who get to work in the world’s most advanced manufacturing facilities. We bring the company’s breakthrough innovations to life by manufacturing technologies that are literally changing the world. TI Process/Equipment Engineers are responsible for all aspects of a wafer fabrication process including tool selection and process definition. They assist with the installation, modification, upgrade and maintenance of the manufacturing equipment. This includes process setup and technician and operator training. This position will use data to make intelligent improvements to overall fabrication process and will be responsible for understanding all aspects of the process performed. This includes the interaction of the process to other fab processing, enabling accurate product dispositions of non-conforming product. Interaction normally requires the ability to gain cooperation of others and conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects/schedules. Aa Manufacturing Product Engineer, you will interface with design, process, test, reliability and manufacturing engineering to solve product issues and production problems, as well as developing process improvements to reduce production costs and increase yields. Manufacturing Product Engineers also manage new product introduction and production support engineering for a specific product or group of products after they have been transferred from design to in-house or outsourced production. As a Texas Instruments (TI) Pit Crew Supervisor/Manufacturing Maintenance Supervisor, you will work in a wafer fab cleanroom environment in the factory with manufacturing direct reports. jobTitle: Manufacturing Process Technician - All Modules (Dallas/Richardson/Sherman, TX)
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments is looking for skilled Process Technicians to join our team as our factories continue to grow and expand in 300mm technologies. This posting is for multiple positions in North Texas. Modules we're hiring in: CMP, Thermal, EPI, Implant, Photo, Plasma, Thin Film, Wet, Parametric Test, Metrology/YE Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To As a process technician in one of our clean rooms, you will perform technical tests and experiments for engineering in the wafer fabrication area of semiconductor manufacturers. Once the product is on the line, the process technician monitors, audits and provides guidance to line operators. Process technicians also test new products and provide technical assistance to process development and engineering personnel. This technician will be an invaluable part of the team, interfacing and communicating with engineering and manufacturing groups across the fab to ensure all issues are solved appropriately and efficiently. Additionally, you will provide process and product support to the organization and address production concerns and disposition of production material. Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirements Associate’s degree in any Technical related field and/or equivalent Military Electronics training and/or relevant experience in lieu of degree Industry or Semiconductor Experience Previous experience as a technician in a wafer fab Preferred Qualifications Ability to identify, multi-task, and resolve multiple priority issues quickly and efficiently to improve overall fab performance Ability to learn and understand process flow quickly, and support the engineering organization as needed Outstanding organizational, teaming, and troubleshooting skills on electrical and mechanical systems Exceptional attention to detail Proficient with MS Office, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong collaborative skills in team environment Excellent communication and presentation skills Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.
