At Texas Instruments (TI) a Manufacturing Production Engineer manages new product introduction and production support engineering for a specific product or group of products after they have been transferred from design to in-house or outsourced production. They interface with design, process, test, reliability and manufacturing engineering to solve product issues and production problems, as well as developing process improvements to reduce production costs and increase yields. Responsibilities Include Support daily production issues at test floor and wafer probe; this includes low yield analysis and disposition, and setup failure debug/analysis and resolution (both hardware and software) Provide detailed analytical study on above issues, and liaise with business units' product engineering team for improvement (test program, hardware, setup, etc.) Engage in productivity improvement projects, including yield improvement, test time reduction, test insertion removal, legacy tester conversion, etc Support new product release from development site. Perform vigorous buyoff for new test systems (program/hardware) per manufacturing requirements Lead and support introduction of new tool/equipment/test processes to manufacturing from new product releases, leading the entire qualification and change management approval within TI Electronic Marketing (TIEM) Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineer, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Physics or related 2 years’ work related experience Preferred Qualifications Experience with Wafer fabrication Experience with Device Physics Experience with Circuit Analysis Experience with Data Analysis Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Problem solving skills, including meticulous attention to details Ability to communicate effectively across functional boundaries and with upper management Ability to work in stressful situations and arrive at creative and effective solutions Ability to think strategically Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments (TI) is looking for an experienced Facilities Bulk Gas Engineer to join our team. As a Facilities Engineer at TI, you’ll be directly responsible for building utility systems in support of a semiconductor wafer fab. TI Facilities operates over 150 different utility systems and focusing on bulk gas and compressed dry air systems. These systems are designed to run 24 hours a day, 365 days a year without interruption, creating a state-of-the-art manufacturing environment. Facilities works closely with TI’s manufacturing team to understand how the utility systems impact the process as well as how to reduce consumption. Responsibilities Include May Include, But Are Not Limited To Sustaining Sustaining engineering support for Mechanical System operations & maintenance, ownership of system capacity vs. demand and system troubleshooting. Provide Facilities system engineering leadership to the site organizations in support of safety, reliability, quality, environmental, and cost objectives. Collaborate with operations and maintenance team to develop plans for maximizing operational and maintenance efficiency. Collaborate with Air Liquide to ensure reliable supply of bulk gases to North Campus factories from their TI Blvd Gas Plant. Participate with them in monthly round table meetings, root cause analysis of failures, FMEA system reviews, and review of any system upgrades or changes. Collaborate directly with the customer in the Fab to ensure installations and projects are completed safely and reliably with minimal to no impact to customer operations. Systems assessment and improvement roadmap establishment and implementation; capital and expense projects execution in support of safety, reliability, quality, environmental and cost objectives. Develop and implement programs targeted to improve quality, efficiency and effectiveness of mechanical systems. Compressed Dry Air Systems including the associated compressors, dryers, filters, and pipelines to the North Campus factories. Nitrogen, Oxygen, Hydrogen, and Argon gases supplied from the Air Liquide Bulk Gas Plant through the pipeline distribution systems to the North Campus factories. Bulk Helium Distribution System from the DM5 Bulk Helium trailers through the pipelines to the North Campus factories. Forming Gas (10%H2/90%N2) Mixer and cylinder backup delivery system from the South Building Chemical Building through pipelines to the factories at SB, SC, and North Buildings. Manage technical, administrative, financial, schedule aspects, strategic communications, and customer stakeholder relationships during the execution of various facilities projects. Permitting and Building Code compliance related to mechanical systems and associated infrastructure. Effectively manage system deliverables including points of delivery, utility parameters, specification limits and notification methods. Develop plans for system continuous improvements and upgrades to support reliable supply of bulk gases and compressed dry air to North Campus factories. Work to integrate reliability focus and risk analysis into Systems Engineering job scope. This includes FMEAs, root cause analysis, cause mapping, design, commissioning and training. Knowledge of chemical compatibility for materials for fluids commonly used in facilities mechanical and process systems. Project Management Team with other engineering disciplines, management, internal customers, and suppliers to ensure projects and systems are cost effective, within budget, meet the desired design criteria and schedule requirements. Responsible for the engineering analysis, design, and installation oversight of distribution systems for chemicals and gas equipment and systems. Oversee projects to meet design criteria, scope, budget and schedule. Review construction management documentation such as submittals and requests for information. Manage all project related financial information to ensure compliance to budget, including change notices, purchase orders, capital forecasts and invoicing. Direct and execute project commissioning to ensure all chemical and gas systems equipment, components and infrastructure perform as designed. Organize and plan design activities, create construction documents or manage external design teams in the execution of such deliverables. Create and communicate project documentation including sequence of operations, installation procedures, and checklists for commissioning and start-up Write scopes of work, bid request for proposals, specify and order material. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering; or equivalent engineering experience. 6 years or more experience with Semiconductor Facilities Mechanical Systems experience designing, maintaining, or installing of mechanical system distribution piping, related system equipment and infrastructure; Experience in Semiconductor Facilities construction; Experience in Facilities industry involving bulk gas and compressed dry air process related systems. Experience with managing projects in design and construction. Self-motivated, flexible, and have ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Collaborative and customer-focused approach. Commitment to a safe, reliable, and efficient work environment. Strong analytical skills for assessing problems, and developing corrective and preventive actions. Excellent time management and priority-setting skills; ability to effectively advance multiple activities concurrently. Ability to interface professionally and effectively with all levels of management. Excellent people skills including leadership and influencing others. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Use Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, AutoCAD and similar software. Preferred Qualifications Demonstrates leadership and project management skills, including organizational, time management and priority setting Able to create construction drawings, details, Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID), Process Flow Diagrams (PFD), etc. Familiarity with mechanical systems. Experience with industrial facilities. Experience with installation, construction, and management of capital projects. Certifications or training with specific semiconductor Mechanical system infrastructure is a plus. Candidate must demonstrate strong safety leadership. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition. Facilities

About The Job Support the DLP® Automotive, Pico, Enterprise, Cinema, and Industrial projection markets with mechanical reference designs and proof of concept prototypes. Interact with hardware and software design teams to assist in overall development of the optical system. System design areas include traditional projection, 3D scanning, head mounted displays, 3D printing, spectroscopy, automotive headlight and head-up displays (HUD). Job Definition Work directly with optical and electrical engineers to create system and component mechanical designs and prototypes. Mechanical design will require detailed tolerance analysis and the generation and testing of thermal designs for DMD chip and illumination sources to meet consumer and automotive requirements. Typical finished project will be prototype and/or EVM often with direct customer engagement and/or placement on TI.com for broad market adoption. Responsibilities Work directly with optical and electrical engineering teams to create system requirements. Design systems and components that house lenses and other optical components and provide the requisite degrees of freedom. The design will require system layout, component design, tolerance analysis, thermal analysis, manufacturability understanding, a drawing package, and final system assembly and testing utilizing various forms of optical metrology. Complex Tasks Detailed thermal design incorporating finite difference/ finite element design tools and 3D CAD design. Management/Organizational Skills Be able to work effectively with all levels of DLP management including field offices. Effectively handle multiple tasks and set priorities, and thrive in a dynamic environment while meeting market window deadlines. Team And People Skills Must be able to communicate and work well in small teams, prepare presentations appropriate to audience, and be able to represent the face of DLP/TI with direct and timely communication to customers as well as internal supervision. Pro-active in acquiring information needed to perform tasks. Projects And Deliverables Opto - Mechanical reference designs; analyze, evaluate prototype system to assist customer getting products to market. This includes systems and opto-mechanical components. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent with a minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0. About The Job TI Kilby Lab is seeking highly qualified applicants for the position of research design engineer for Machine Learning enabled by Compute-in-Memory (CiM) technology for In-the-sensor-Computing in various IoT applications. Our team pursues deeply embedded, ultra-low power AI compute IC HW/SW to enable various smart audio/video devices, industrial sensor nodes, robotics, smart edge computing applications. As a member of the team, you will work on some of the most challenging technical problems. Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To You will lead the development of low cost, ultra-low power, robust CiM macro(s) based on SRAM and other NVM technologies, and associated architecture and algorithmic innovations in the context of Deep Neural Network hardware acceleration and feature-extraction You will work with various technologists from R&D team as well as various business units inside the company to put the solution from idea into products In addition, you will have opportunity to engage with technical communities in TI to share your ideas and solutions Minimum Requirements Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering/Chemical Engineering (Analog/Digital Signal Processing/Circuit Design) or related areas Preferred Experience Project level experience for Compute-in-Memory: which includes (but not limited to) in-depth knowledge of memory architecture, design, layout and process for SRAM and or NVM along with associated analog interface design (ADC/DAC) and timing circuits to implement DNN or any other computational applications Benchmark against none CiM based implementation with performance, power consumption, form factor for tradeoff analysis and architecture decisions Experience in silicon implementation, verification and validation of CiM macro and mixed-signal IPs as well as embedded CPU (such as ARM Cortex-M) based SoCs Experience in architecting/designing of ultra-low power mixed-signal sensing elements such as ADC/DAC, various filters, signal conditioning, analog components calibration over environmental parameters in the area of: circuits – design and verification, modelling for optimal analog-digital partitioning, cost/power optimizations, etc. Good understanding of CMOS process technology – including scaling, key technology components such as SRAM/NVM bit-cell, multi-Vt and multi-voltage support etc. Good understanding of Machine Learning technologies: feature-extraction, DNN topologies and algorithms, DNN training and quantization frameworks such as PyTorch/TensorFlow Be able to perform system level integrated performance benchmark and tests: HW vs SW implementations, MIPS/Memory/power trade-offs as well as experience at chip creation Comfortably get on the bench in the lab to take the measurements and debug the HW components at both IC level as well as PCB level. Collecting Analog or Digital signals using various lab equipment Excellent programming skills in Python, Pytorch, TensorFlow, MATLAB, C/C++, as well as analog design platforms (Spice, etc.) in the server farm platform Familiar with TinyML Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment, to execute on the tasks assigned, to meet the project deadlines and at the same time, to explore independently new innovative ideas that can improve and optimize Ability to work with other research design engineers from multiple disciplines to create, test, benchmark/calibrate and optimize the final product Be able to deliver end results with highest standards of quality, scientific rigor, innovation, and ease of use Why TI? About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Here’s your chance to work in a state-of-the-art 300mm analog wafer fab. In this role, you’ll work with our engineering team as a DMOS6 Process Integration engineer. Responsibilities Include Delivering competitive advantage to TI / DMOS6 through technology development, technology transfer, and continuous improvement of current manufacturing technologies. Ownership of technology, technology parametric performance, Parametric Cpk improvements, parametric test dispositions including root cause determination for scrap or outliers, definition and evaluations of experiments to improve processes, short flow development, product flow creation/review, cross functional team leadership, to support the development, qualification, and manufacturing of advanced analog technologies. Ownership of technology / process routing working closely with process engineers to drive process and device improvements through design of experiments, implementation of experiments (SWRs), characterization, test, data analysis (inline, parametric, yield) and communication of results to engineering teams. Candidate should have strong Process Integration and device experience. Cross functional team leadership to support the development, qualification, and manufacturing of advanced analog technologies. Lead process development/integration activities in team, small group and one-on-one meetings. Interface and work with other teams and support members from operations, Analog Technology Development (ATD), Business Units, Quality, and other factories via WebEx, face-to-face visits, and phone calls. Utilize technical knowledge of semiconductor device physics, across range of active and passive components used in each technology, to enable competitive technology through process, device, and parametric improvements. Strong working knowledge of parametric analysis and parametric test structures. Knowledge of SRAM and also NVM such as embedded Flash and FRAM is desireable. The person performing this role must be capable to plan effectively, drive schedules, meet critical deadlines on multiple tasks in parallel, lead technical discussions in their area of expertise, and work effectively across organizational boundaries. They must be able to clearly communicate project status and actions. Additionally, they must be able to interface with multiple organizations and work well on a diverse team to accomplish goals. Minimum Requirements MS in Electrical Engineering with semiconductor specific knowledge: semiconductor fabrication and device knowledge, solid state physics, applied physics or quantum mechanics 5 years of relevant expereince OR PhD in Electrical Engineering with semiconductor specific knowledge: semiconductor fabrication and device knowledge, solid state physics, applied physics or quantum mechanics Cumulative GPA 3.0 or above Preferred Qualifications & Skills Strong process / semiconductor fabrication and process integration knowledge. Knowledge of semiconductor devices and solid state physics (semiconductors and materials). Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills. Drive to derive and implement solutions Strong verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Good teamwork skills to work across all groups, along with good communication and presentation skills. Must be able to organize and analyze data and coordinate project plans across various groups. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. The Role Includes Activities Such As Texas Instruments is seeking a Process Engineering Intern within the Analog Technology Development (ATD) Group. We work to define and develop the next generation process and device technologies for TI. The metal system is critical for achieving reliable, low resistance interconnects for power devices, for enabling area scaling and high process yields to drive cost leadership and to achieve high precision resistors and capacitor components. The interconnect process integration engineer is a key member of a team that defines and develops the processes and process flows to achieve the interconnect performance and reliability needs, whether it be low resistance with good electro-migration capability for the latest high current applications or high precision resistors for high performance amplifiers. defining electrical test circuits to assess process capability versus design rule, characterizing and analyzing process yield data, assessing the reliability of the metal and dielectric of the interconnect system, and then working within the team to drive the necessary actions to meet the yield and reliability needs for the technology. Minimum Requirements Currently pursuing Masters degree or PhD in areas such as Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry or related engineering degree. Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA or higher Preferred Qualifications Strong materials background in metal and/or dielectrics Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results, influential relationships Good listener and excellent verbal and written communication skills Why TI? We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. In Analog Technology Development (ATD), we create and deliver innovative technology roadmaps and platforms to enable robust, cost-competitive and industry-leading TI products. The Technology Transfer team’s goal is to ensure a successful transfer of TI’s leading edge technologies to additional fabs in advance of customer demand, to enable TI’s worldwide manufacturing flexibility and capacity needs. In this position, you will partner with ATD technologists, sending/receiving factory engineering teams, quality representatives, business design and product test groups, to drive critical performance validation of devices in the new fab. This includes supporting characterization of the variety of semiconductor components in the technology, as well as performing product-level yield and performance evaluations to qualify a process baseline to match the original fab. Responsibilities Include Full ownership of the component characterization efforts for transfer intrinsic qual. Collaborate with transfer project managers/ ATD/ mother fab to define a clear characterization plan. Collaborate with ATD Device Characterization Lab for test program development. Perform data analysis and fab-fab sameness verification to technology and transfer metrics. Co-drive process improvements to meet transfer goals. Collaborate with receiving fab product engineering team to perform product yield and performance comparisons between fabs, and identify correlations to fab signals. Interface with business group design, product and test teams to confirm areas of fab process or test improvements needed, to improve product yield and ensure product quality. The person performing this role will be supporting multiple technology transfers. Must be capable to plan effectively, drive schedules, meet critical deadlines on multiple tasks in parallel, lead technical discussions, and work effectively across organizational boundaries. They must be able to clearly communicate project status and actions, interface with multiple organizations and work well on a diverse team to accomplish goals. Minimum Requirements MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or Material Science (Semiconductor Device-Related) Cumulative GPA 3.0 Preferred Qualifications - Knowledge of semiconductor solid state physics (devices), and semiconductor technology Demonstrate strong data analysis, data-mining and other analytical skills Proficient use of data analysis tools like SPOTFIRE, MBAYSE, etc., or ability to learn new tools Strong time management skills that enable on-time delivery of multiple parallel projects Ability to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders critical to success, both internally and externally Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly ramp on new systems and processes Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Willing to travel within and outside US Why TI? About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job In this role, you’ll work on our Analog Technology Development (ATD) Technology Transfer team working as a Project Manager. You will lead the transfer of advanced analog process technologies from one fab to another fab to meet customer-specific dual sourcing requirements for assurance of supply and to enable capacity in advance of customer demand. You will partner with sending and receiving factory engineering and manufacturing teams, business groups, quality representatives and ATD technologists to reproduce and qualify process baselines that match the original fab physically and electrically in terms of parametric, yield, characterization and reliability metrics. Since transfers occur in every TI facility, you will gain an insightful perspective across the multi-fab ONE MAKE organization and in various business units. Opportunities for travel will allow you to build strong network and relationships needed for project success. This role is critical for the success of TI growth and market share priorities. Primary And Secondary Responsibilities The person performing this role must be capable to plan effectively, drive schedules, meet critical deadlines on multiple tasks in parallel, lead technical discussions in their area of expertise, and work effectively across organizational boundaries. They must be able to clearly communicate project status and actions. Additionally, they must be able to interface with multiple organizations and work well on a diverse team to accomplish goals. Tasks include: Cross functional team leadership to support the transfer, qualification, and manufacturing of advanced analog technologies in new factories (internal and/or external to TI) to support TI growth plans and capacity needs of our customers. Coordinate the collection of all technical details needed to reproduce the technology from sending fab and arrange technical training for receiving factory. Co-own set up of the receiving fab total integrated process flow. Conduct risk assessments. Design and develop silicon plans to mitigate risks. Work with sending fab, receiving fab and ATD engineering teams to identify differences between fabs that might add risk and to establish process improvement plans to mitigate risks. Lead problem solving activities during transfer. Coordinate and participate in group meetings, project conference calls and management reviews. Communicate program status and key milestones to vested stakeholders. Learn and drive execution of the ATD Technology Transfer methodology. Coordinate with other partner organizations (planning, business teams, quality organization, technology development, characterization resources, etc.) to secure support needed to meet program schedule and success metrics. Minimum Requirements BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science or a semiconductor specific field of study (solid state physics, applied physics or quantum mechanics or related engineering degree) 8 years of experience in wafer fabrication or related process integration/device experience Strong team leading experience and communication skills Deep interests in semiconductor technology, a team player and a hard worker with strong drive for execution. Preferred Skills & Qualifications Knowledge of semiconductor solid state physics (devices and materials). Traditional wafer fab process integration skill sets Sound data analysis, data-mining and other analytical skills Demonstrated problem solving Drive to derive and implement solutions Proficient use of data analysis tools like SPOTFIRE, MBAYSE, etc. This engineer must be able to organize data and plan across various groups General: organized, good communicator, efficient with time, effective with others, strong sense of urgency, takes ownership. Good communication and presentation skills are essential for success Good teamwork skills to work across all groups. Willing to travel within and outside US To be considered for this position, please apply to this requisition. jobTitle: Process Integration and Device Development Engineer
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. A Process Integration and Device Development Engineer is responsible for the development, characterization and optimization of silicon semiconductor devices and process flows to fabricate them to meet the requirements for volume production as part of the Analog Technology Development team. The ideal candidate will be a technical leader in the area of process integration and CMOS devices, driving the characterization and optimization of the device and process flow to ensure robustness, reliability, and manufacturability while meeting all electrical device performance targets. Responsibilities Include Drive process flow and device improvements through characterization, test, design of experiments, data analysis and simulation Work with multiple process, integration, reliability, packaging and test engineers to achieve device performance and manufacturability goals Work closely with the wafer fab to develop a robust and manufacturable process flow. The person performing this role must be capable to plan effectively, drive schedules, meet critical deadlines on multiple tasks in parallel, lead technical discussions in their area of expertise, and work effectively across organizational boundaries. They must be able to clearly communicate project status and actions. Additionally, they must be able to interface with multiple organizations and work well on a diverse team to accomplish goals. Minimum Requirements M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree 5 years of experience working on silicon semiconductor devices, taking these devices from development to production on schedule Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Materials Engineering, Physics, or related degree Have a complete working knowledge of Si device design and processing Be proficient in process integration and driving yield improvements Ability to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders critical to success, both internally and externally Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly ramp on new systems and processes Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions and locations Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Why TI? About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. About The Job The Test Cell Optimization (TCO) team under the Test Technology Group is looking for a product engineer to apply product engineering principles using data from test cells and databases to improve test cell health and performance, including cost of test. The TCO engineer will focus on projects that analyze raw data from test-cells and build analytic models to improve performance and productivity. The applicant should have data analytics and test engineering background, a strong problem-solving ability with proficiency in statistical analysis. The job function takes data from various data sources to provide in-depth knowledge and insight of test operation activities for identifying gaps and opportunities for improvement. Using this information, strategic actions can be taken by the test engineer community and management to drive the overall performance gain of the test fleet and test solution for achieving business goals. Do you want to work for an organization that values your opinion? Do you want to work for an organization where you can play a pivotal role in several different areas? Look no further. As a Texas Instruments Product Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a vibrant and dynamic team oriented environment with exposure to a variety of state-of-the art applications each day. Responsibilities May Include Drive test cell improvements by optimizing performance and creating new capability / technology / infrastructure / standard to overcome technical hurdles Align with various stakeholders (e.g. business managers, finance, planning) to derive a sound strategy and execution plan to make productivity gains Build analytic systems and compile reports of test data to enable business groups to reach business objectives Analyze test cost data collected from various data sources to evaluate entitlement opportunity through benchmarking to identify and recommend the lowest cost test solution (including development, hardware, operational overhead) Study business and emerging trends to determine the test complexity of a product family for alignment, scalability, and comparative analysis Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or related fields 3 years of relevant experience Strong organizational skills with excellent verbal and written communication ability Solid understanding of the product and test development infrastructure and work process, be capable of effectively driving technical and non-technical teams. Must show initiative, demonstrate excellent organizational and problem-solving skills with the passion to learn and develop streamlined functions Good knowledge of programming languages (e.g. C/C++), coding skills and scripting tools such as R or Python Knowledge of data analytics, connectivity, organization, management and visualization techniques and software development tools A knack for complex statistical analysis and predictive modeling Proficient in SQL programming and database connection Must be flexible to work within US, European and Asian business hours Preferred Qualifications Familiarity and experience with wafer probing, assembly and test factories, semiconductor manufacturing and operations or similar roles Ability to multiplex between projects and be able to maintain project schedules Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Ability to multiplex between projects and be able to maintain project schedules Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Program Experience how the latest innovative technologies are developed, built and optimized during this two-year program as a product and test or validation engineer. Work with TI teams, customers and external partners around the world to design, build, qualify and support our industry-leading analog and embedded processing products. As a product and test engineer, you play a vital role in assuring the quality and performance of TI’s innovative IC products. From test software and hardware development, product debugging and test optimization – you help ensure our products are consistently competitive and leading in the market. Gain an inside track through two, one-year rotations. The first in product and test or validation engineering, then a second complementary rotation where you’ll dive deeper into manufacturing, quality, design verification or validation engineering. In this role, you’ll support the development and implementation of strategies that achieve profitability targets on assigned TI product lines through new product development, cost reduction, capacity expansion and yield enhancement projects. You’ll serve as the primary point of contact for all operational aspects related to your assigned product portfolio, resolve customer quality and application issues, and facilitates cross-functional teams for problem solving. You’ll also take a leadership role to establish relationships with key contacts in TI wafer fabrication and assembly manufacturing sites to ensure strong communication and effective problem solving. The first rotation assignment places you on a product/test engineering team in one of TI’s product lines or TI’s Test, Technology and Product Engineering group. During this assignment, you will gain a broad knowledge of the wide range of products within the product line, become proficient with TI’s various testers, handlers and probers, and gain hands-on experience designing a board to test a device. This rotation is followed by another 12-month exciting assignment, in either an engineering role in TI’s WW Quality organization, interacting with customers, TI Business Units and Wafer fabrication, a Design Verification and Validation role in a product line, a product engineering role in one of TI’s most advanced fabrication facility, or a test engineering role in TI’s Test, Technology and Product Engineering group. At the end of your program, you’ll become a member of one of our product/test teams where you will work on leading-edge semiconductor technologies while improving efficiency and quality and directly contributing to TI’s bottom line. Opportunities are available in North America, Asia and Europe. Minimum Requirements Minimum BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field Minimum Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Ability to analyze and interpret data, interpret customer input and apply input to TI’s products and processes Ability to take the initiative and ownership for implementing solutions that improve product quality Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Texas Instruments is looking for a skilled Product Test Technician to join our team. This technician will be an invaluable part of the team, interfacing and communicating with engineering and manufacturing groups across the fab to ensure all issues are solved appropriately and efficiently. Additionally, you will provide process and product support to the organization and address production concerns and disposition of production material. As a product technician in one of our clean rooms, you will provide technical support for a specific product or group of products, from product definition and planning through production and release. jobTitle: Product, Test & Validation Engineer Rotation Program
jobDescription: We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Product/Test/Validation Engineers at Texas Instruments are powered by a passion for enabling production capability and continual improvement. Our solutions make a real difference and yours will, too. We make the semiconductor product design process easier and faster, which helps our customers succeed in today's fast-paced marketplace. Job Description In this role, you’ll support the development and implementation of strategies that achieve profitability targets on assigned TI product lines through new product development, cost reduction, capacity expansion and yield enhancement projects. You’ll serve as the primary point of contact for all operational aspects related to your assigned product portfolio, resolve customer quality and application issues, and facilitate cross-functional teams for problem solving. You’ll also take a leadership role to establish relationships with key contacts in TI wafer fabrication and assembly manufacturing sites to ensure strong communication and effective problem solving. In this empowering, 18-month rotation program, you’ll be on an accelerated development track that’s focused on the product development cycle. As a program participant, you’ll rotate through two assignments centered on improving product efficiency and quality, which contributes directly to the company’s bottom line. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to be mentored and develop strong collaboration skills through cross-functional group interaction. You’ll also have the chance to establish customer relationships. The first rotation assignment places you on a product/test/validation engineering team in one of TI’s product lines for 12 months. During this assignment, you will gain a broad knowledge of the wide range of products within the product line. You will have the opportunity to become proficient with TI’s various handlers and probers, program our testers and bench equipment, and/or gain hands-on experience in designing automated test or bench solutions (software and hardware) to test devices. This rotation is followed by a 6-month assignment to introduce you to a different perspective through another hands-on experience with the products in an adjacent role and/or within another TI product line or TI’s Test, Technology Group area. At the end of your program, you’ll become a member of one of our product/test teams where you will work on leading-edge semiconductor technologies while improving efficiency and quality and directly contributing to Texas Instruments’ bottom line. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position. Minimum Requirements Bachelors in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical Systems, or related degree with coursework or experience in programming and Analog or Digital circuit analysis and design Cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA or higher Preferred Qualifications Ability to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders critical to success, both internally and externally Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly ramp on new systems and processes Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Why TI? Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments is looking for an energetic engineer with a passion for Reliability. This position provides the opportunity to drive continual improvement at all levels. Evaluates, from a reliability standpoint, the materials, properties and techniques used in production. Work with new technology and new product development teams assessing product reliability with respect to its target field application. Drives utilization of best engineering practice, test methods and statistical process control procedures for achieving required levels of product reliability. Determines reliability requirements of components and systems to achieve company, customer and any governmental agency reliability objectives. Develops new acceleration techniques and analytical tools to assure the early identification of potential problems with new products, packaging, processes, and product reliability. Makes recommendations for changes in the selection and application of components and systems. May propose changes in design or formulation to improve system and/or process reliability. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! In this role you will evaluate, from a reliability standpoint, the materials, properties and techniques used in production. TI Process Engineers are responsible for all aspects of a wafer fabrication process including tool selection and process definition. They assist with the installation, modification, upgrade and maintenance of the manufacturing equipment. This includes process setup and technician and operator training. This position will use data to make intelligent improvements to overall fabrication process and will be responsible for understanding all aspects of the process performed. This includes the interaction of the process to other fab processing, enabling accurate product dispositions of non-conforming product. Interaction normally requires the ability to gain cooperation of others and conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects/schedules. In this semiconductor fab engineer role with Texas Instruments’ worldwide manufacturing organization, you will be responsible for engineering process optimization efforts to achieve fab cycle time goals. You will interface with various modules, in addition to yield, product and integration teams, to resolve issues that limit yield performance. This is a compressed day shift role, A shift or C shift. The Senior Investigator is responsible for conducting investigations in accordance with legal requirements and company policies, along with managing and supporting the company’s overall programs, systems and policies that are designed to identify and respond to incidents of theft, fraud and other criminal or unethical activity. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job As a member of the Embedded Processors team, you will be working on state-of-the-art processors and microcontrollers to make the world smarter, safer, and greener. These products are the heart of autonomous vehicles, intelligent robots, electric vehicles, and energy efficient homes and push the boundaries of technology integrating deep learning accelerators, ARM/RISC-V compute cores, vision analytics, networking, security, and multimedia. You will help build products that will transform the world by making technology reachable, affordable and accessible for all. As a Software Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for the definition, design, development, test, documentation, and support of embedded software (firmware, software frameworks and API’s, algorithmic libraries, etc.) to maximize TI internal and end-customer ease-of-use for a diverse range of CPU’s (DSP, ARM, and RISC-V) and cutting-edge innovative IP’s (machine-learning, networking and packet processing, high-performance I/O, etc.). You will also have the opportunity to develop and utilize tools to insure our IP meets functional, performance, and power requirements. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. About The Job At TI, System Engineers work to identify ideal roadmap opportunities for a business and are responsible for defining new products and platforms based on market opportunity. To do this, they leverage strong technical knowledge of our existing portfolio, deep understanding of the technologies, standards and protocols within an industry or end equipment, and an ability to engage with customers and translate their requirements into technical specifications that will solve their problems. Systems engineers also partner closely with marketing and applications engineers, as well as design teams, to ensure our roadmap is both meeting customer and market requirements and is technically optimized and manufacturable at a price and cost point that makes sense for the business. In this role you will define and design power electronics converters for automotive LED lighting applications. Our team is built of experts in designing mixed signal ICs and proven mentors helping to shape the next generation of engineers. As a System Engineer, you will work closely with analog and digital design, the validation engineering team, and our Automotive and Automotive OEM customers. The Automotive LED lighting market is in a state of consistent evolution, you’ll be given the opportunity to: Define new products Work on new ideas that have the ability to impact semi-autonomous and autonomous driving vehicles Designing and testing power electronics converters including Boost, Buck and SEPIC The key to success in this role is to understand the unique nature of LED lighting and LED as a load. After joining you’ll spend focused time with different members of the team to get to know and understand our existing products, different techniques of driving LEDs (linear, switcher and matrix), as well as test new silicon. Our vision is to recruit top talent that will help TI to maintain its leadership position in automotive lighting. Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To Specify device performance parameter Work with analog and digital design engineering team to create functional block diagram, top level simulation models Interface with car OEMs and Tier-1/2 manufacturers to access their current and future needs for LED driver ICs Prototype, debug, test and validate new silicon Create datasheet, apply patents and submit original research papers at internal and external conferences You would be great for this role if you’ve previously worked on power electronics converter and are familiar with basic control theory. The expected compensation range for this role is $102,000.00 - $136,000.00 and position in this range will be based on a variety of factors, including the specific experience and skill set of the candidate. In addition to a competitive total compensation package, TI seeks to provide employees with benefits to help manage their health, save for the future, allow time off to rejuvenate, and to protect against unexpected risks at work or in life. Please review this link (http://www.ti.com/lit/sszb162) for additional information on benefits and other compensation elements for eligible TI employees. At TI, Systems Engineers focus deeply on understanding the technical needs, and future trends of an industry or end equipment, then create new products and innovative forward-looking product roadmaps to solve them. Systems Engineers are an integral part each phase of new product development at TI. TI’s Technical Documentation development program is a 12-month program designed to accelerate your evolution from new college graduate to a strong technical editor that businesses rely upon and collaborate closely with in order to meet and exceed goals. The Technical Documentation Development Program is a challenging and competitive program that offers real-world experience in several roles, providing an excellent foundation for career growth and advancement. Learning Tools/Processes/Standards Learn creation tools – Web and Oxygen editors, DITA based content Learn processes from getting new requests, to setting up content, working with subject matter experts, editing, and publication of content Learn illustration, writing and content specific standards Execute while learning Execute short form docs from request to publish For documents you own – go through full process from request to publish, update and create illustrations, learn translation process (shadow translation team) Backend knowledge Help test and troubleshoot issues Assist with data analysis and competitive analysis Upon successful completion of the development program, rotators are welcomed as Technical Writers on TI’s Technical Documentation team. About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job! About The Job Texas Instruments is looking for an energetic, results-minded leader to become part of our team as a Test Cell Engineering Manager. This is a great leadership opportunity to lead a team of test technology subject matter experts working on development and deployment of test infrastructure at TI within the Supplier Technology & Quality Organization in TTG. Typical projects are high volume – high revenue directly impacting company’s bottom line. As the Test Cell Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of tester, handler and docking/interface experts at TI to integrate these technologies into optimal test cell solutions. In this role, you’ll be working in highly cross-functional environment engaging various TI BU’s, TI Test sites, technology suppliers to help drive TI Test strategy and engineering projects establishing high quality test capability ahead of the need at optimal total cost of test through PPIT engagement. Team is also chartered to continuously conduct industry level competitive assessments to source, develop and deploy breakthrough test cell solutions to achieve our mission of making TI competitive at Test. Responsibilities Include As a leader of the Test Cell Engineering team, you will source, develop and lead best in class technology talent pool to help achieve objectives. Identify, develop and deploy test cell capability and infrastructure to TI engineering and production sites ahead of the need and meeting performance expectations through deep engagement in TI’s PPIT (Process, Package, IP & Test) process. Execute industry level competitive assessment to drive integration and deployment of optimal test cell solutions that differentiates TI from competition. Own TI Test Strategy roadmap in the area of Test Cell, Tester, Handler and Interface/Docking Identify and resolve/optimize technology issues in high volume production and/or engineering sites impacting productivity, cost and quality. Collaborate within TTG with Test Solutions (device application) and Test Infrastructure & Automation (NPD tools/automation and test cell software) teams to execute qualification of new and/or improved test cell technologies. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical & Computer Engineering or Mechanical Engineering 5+ years of experience in semiconductor development and manufacturing. Preferred Qualifications Analog and Mixed signal test techniques and manufacturing test process Hands on experience in Test Engineering is an added advantage Understanding of the IC product development process, from concept to volume production Data analysis skills using Spotfire or equivalent tool Ability to proactively take the initiative and drive for results Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project execution Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Strong analytical and methodological problem-solving skills with critical thinking Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills. Ability to multi-task and work in a dynamic environment and manage multiple stake holder expectation and interactions. Demonstrated ability to build strong and influential relationships. Ability to source, develop and retain best in class test talent. Willingness to learn new things even when it might not directly be related to the job role/responsibility Demonstrated leadership skills with confidant and charismatic personality To be considered for this position, please apply. We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. Are you looking to grow your career in testing at one of the leading semiconductor companies in the world? At Texas Instruments (TI) a Test Engineer is part of a team responsible for designing, developing, and implementing cost-effective methods of testing and troubleshooting systems and equipment. In this role, the Test Engineer prepares test and diagnostic programs, designs test fixtures and equipment, completes specifications and procedures for new products. About The Job Test engineering role in TI’s Analog Technology Development (ATD) Characterization Labs: the Characterization Lab team is responsible for characterizing the broad range of technologies and devices developed at TI – including power devices (DMOS, DeMOS, CMOS), advanced CMOS, high speed bipolar (SiGe HBTs), passives, and novel devices. Our organization has deep expertise in characterizing semiconductor devices ranging in all types of measurements such as parametric and bench systems, low to high frequency, low power/precision to high power devices, reliability, and special devices requiring novel test approaches. The primary responsibilities for the role include: on-wafer device level testing (via probe stations and testing on semiconductor wafers), writing test programs, creating drivers for equipment communication, developing test automation, innovating new test solutions, analyzing data, and collaborating with technology development teams, fabs, design teams, and vendors on test related strategy, approaches, and challenges. Minimum Requirements Masters in Electrical Engineering, Material Scinecne or related degree Cumulative GPA 3.0 Preferred Qualifications ATE knowledeg on Teradyne Eagle or equivalent analog ATE (iFlex, LTX, VLCT) Characterization test program and hardware development knowledge Production test program and hardware development knowledge Technical knowledge of electronic devices and circuits, and Analog test techniques Data analysis skills using Spotfire, dataPower or equivalent tool based on STDF Experienced with various lab equipment such as scopes, power supplies, sourcemeters, loads etc. Experience with product engineering activities such as yield improvement and test time reduction Understanding of the IC product development process, from concept to volume production Proficiency in programming/scripting in C++, Python, C# Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Why TI? About The Job This is a unique opportunity to be part of a team that drives test technology infrastructure for testing of highly integrated semiconductor devices going into markets with significant growth potential. The ideal candidate would have a background that includes probe technology and wafer level testing of complex embedded processing, RF and mixed signal circuits. The Probe Technology Test Engineer supports development and release of production worthy technologies needed to support probe test needs of TI products. This role ensures the integrity of the probe test solutions produced in the supply chain and used inside TI factories and subcons. This individual proactively drives the supplier roadmaps to continually be well ahead of TI business technology roadmaps so we are always prepared for product ramp of new product test needs. The role also supports probe technology & process improvements, problem-solving efforts with the focus on assuring highest quality probe test solutions for the Businesses & Multi-Probe areas. This role requires high collaboration with Procurement and Probe suppliers while taking input from the businesses, factories and other Test Technology Group (TTG) internal facing teams. Responsibilities Include Interact extensively with TTG, Semiconductor Packaging (SCP), Analog Technology Development (ATD), and Probe Suppliers, to meet product development needs. Act as the primary representative for TTG in developing all new and improved probe technologies that are needed to meet TI business product test roadmaps. Own and document probe technology qualification & testing requirements needed to prove new technologies are acceptable for use in TI applications. Collaborate with Quality Team and perform supplier audits, and drive corrective actions with suppliers that relate directly to the quality of their technology. Execute and own all new supplier qualifications for new probe technologies and through these publish and own the TI approved list of all probe technologies and guidelines on how to select them. Analyze data and review with teams to make final qualification decisions. Define internal qualification systems & test vehicles to enable TI to do internal probe pin qualifications ahead of device ramp and collect factual data on the pin performance. Recommend performance monitoring systems to track supplier performance objectively and work with users of technology to ensure probe technologies are performing per TI expectations. Organize and drive supplier technology review meetings with probe head vendors with Procurement and TTG teams and own each supplier technologies that are approved for use inside TI. Work with Procurement teams to manage overall supplier technical performance with Procurement team being main supplier performance management driver overall. Define deliverables, conformance, specifications, procedures that we hold suppliers accountable to and own all communications & training of these requirements to the suppliers. International and Domestic Travel are required periodically to visit suppliers and factories. Define deliverables, conformance, specifications, procedures that we hold production test sites accountable to and own all communications & training of these requirements Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering 5 years of related experience Knowledge of probe test operation and common probe card technology problems Working experience with cross functional teams like, Design, Product and Test. ATE programming, test data analysis, test cell debug experience is a plus Experience working with the production test sites to understand the device specific failures and align it to probe card technology performance. Knowledge of TEL & Accretech probers to define probe technology parameters within the prober automation is a an added advantage, Ability to run the prober and execute probe technology validation/checkout Preferred Qualifications Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Ability to take the initiative and drive for results Strong analytics and problem Solving Skills Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Working well in a team environment, external suppliers is imperative in this role. Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships Good listener and excellent verbal and written communication skills Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. About The Job Test is a crucial time in an IC development process; if you find a bug or an issue, it is a good time to fix it, but every additional second of testing we do, is additional cost when you scale a device into production. So, test engineers must identify the critical points of the device where testing is most necessary and the points where we may want to take some risk. It is a precise balance, that has the potential to save our businesses millions of dollars! Test engineers spend a good amount of time in the lab and when they're not there, they are designing test hardware using software tools like cadence and building test programs on an ATE simulator, or troubleshooting – the programs or the device. A typical day-to-day in this role is software and hardware development for testing Automotive LED Drivers (Buck, Matrix, Multi-topology) In this role, you will work most closely with all functional disciplines (Design, Systems, Marketing, Applications, DV, Validation and Product) Key Responsibilities Of This Role Include Software Development Hardware Development ETS364 Data Analysis and Silicon Debug Work and build relationships with Global Teams Work on new, cutting-edge, inovative products in the Automotive Lighting industry You would be great for this role if you have previously worked as a test engineer focused on power managment products and/or DC/DC converters. The expected compensation range for this role is $69,000/yr - $118,000/yr and position in this range will be based on a variety of factors, including the specific experience and skill set of the candidate. In addition to a competitive total compensation package, TI seeks to provide employees with benefits to help manage their health, save for the future, allow time off to rejuvenate, and to protect against unexpected risks at work or in life. Please review this link (Why TI) for additional information on benefits and other compensation elements for eligible TI employees. Experience with API / EDI / RPA connectivity and order management Preferred Qualifications Recent hands-on experience in project management space Experience developing end-to-end eCommerce strategy through a full lifecycle implementation Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. About The Job Texas Instruments has an immediate opening for a Transportation Specialist supporting global manufacturing shipping operations. The position is located in Dallas, TX. This position will be responsible for managing shipments into and between TI sites; including but not limited to: direct materials, indirect materials, capital, and work in process inventory. This position will play a vital role in managing Texas Instruments global supply chain infrastructure with specific focus on support of manufacturing operations across all TI sites and contract manufacturing facilities. Priorities include: assurance of supply, transit time optimization, cost reduction, and quality assurance. Collaboration with Freight Forwarders and 3PL’s will be key to success. Primary Responsibilities Manage a specific subset of TI shipments (ex. US outbound semi-finished goods; inbound commodity specific raw materials, etc). Provide logistical support to assist manufacturing, procurement, and finance. Provide analysis/reporting on shipping metrics. Execute strategic projects to drive process improvement. Collaborate with 3PL partners to drive strategic initiatives. Collaborate with global TI sites to develop strategy, optimize shipping, resolve issues, and drive standardization. Work closely with freight forwarders to solve unique problems and resolve issues. Ensure compliance to TI shipping processes/SPECS. Manage cost through innovation and supplier collaboration. What You Will Gain From This Role Immediate responsibility of supply chain management that directly affects TI operations. In depth understanding of global logistics including shipping modes, incoterms, and compliance. Exposure to global teams and diverse projects/objectives. Direct involvement in TI growth/expansion (Richardson facility, Sherman facility, Lehi facility, Chengdu facility, Melaka facility). Opportunities to lead projects, act strategically, innovate, and cultivate relationships across TI. Exposure/visibility to executive leadership across TI. Opportunities to work with cross-functional teams in finance, operations, planning, procurement, and manufacturing. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Finance, Business, Engineering or related field 3+ years of experience Strong project management skills, supplier management skills, analytical skills, and excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to work across organizations, solve complex problems, drive results and improvement, and manage multiple priorities. Ability to lead project activities and effectively communicate to all levels of management with appropriate urgency. Demonstrated strategic thinking and analytical problem-solving capability. Familiarity with semiconductor manufacturing processes. High level of computer literacy and working knowledge of Outlook, Excel, Word, Power Point and SharePoint. About The Job Automotive FPD-Link SerDes devices transmit high-resolution video signals with fewer wires in automotive systems for a variety of interfaces, including cameras for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) and infotainment displays, which enable self-driving applications and video displays in vehicles.The FPD-Link product line is seeking a well-qualified candidate to participate as a validation engineer in the organization’s Validation Engineering team. In this position, you will partner with design, systems, product, and test engineering teams to help bring high quality, innovative products to market. You will also work with our application engineers to answer customer questions and help debug complex customer problems giving you exposure to how our customers use our parts and common problems our customers face. These customer facing activities will be used to help guide the validation process for future devices which will further improve the quality of the devices we offer to our customers. Validation Engineers are responsible for performing device level validation on new products as well as designing, implementing, and improving accurate methods of making automated measurements which cover both the device’s specified performance as well as its system level robustness. Typical Responsibilities Include Validation of FPD-Link SerDes (Serializers / Deserializers) at the block level, physical layer, protocol layer, and system level. Develop hardware and software for automated measurement systems Design and debug bench hardware Provide system level expertise to the design team and attend design reviews to evaluate potential system level problems during the design phase Provide customer support for application questions and issues in between new product development tasks (approximately 20% of time) Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, ECE, or related field 4+ years of relevant experience Solid hardware and software debugging skills Familiarity with Python coding environments Strong technical background, with the ability to produce high quality technical documentation Good listener and excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Preferred Qualifications 8+ years of relevant experience Experience performing new product validation Familiarity with automated testing using bench equipment Familiarity with Bitbucket/Git software revision control Hands on experience with PCB design and high-speed signal integrity Experience with CPU validation and firmware development Familiarity with SerDes (Serializers / Deserializers) sub-blocks such as Fractional PLL, FFE, CTLE, DFE, CDR, FEC as well as NRZ and PAM4 encoding Familiarity with video interfaces such as DisplayPort, embedded DisplayPort and MIPI CSI-2, D-PHY, C-PHY Familiarity with release of AEC-Q100 automotive qualified devices Why TI? jobTitle: Wireless Automotive Embedded Software Engineer- Connectivity
jobDescription: About TI Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping about 100,000 customers transform the future, today. About The Job Come join the Connectivity Software Development Team and help drive the development of Texas Instrument’s Wireless Battery Management System (WBMS) Software. You will be an integral part of the team leading the wireless battery management revolution, working on the software that is leading the electric vehicle revolution. Your work will be making the world a more connected and greener place. Become a part of the team that won the 2022 gold for Wireless Communications from Elektronik for the impact we are making in the embedded automotive space! You will build critical features contributing to TI’s WBMS embedded software enabling our automotive customers to build modern electric vehicles on the CC2662R-Q1 and roadmap parts. Partner with automotive systems, applications, and software test engineers to create and improve features for our software protocols. Responsibilities Include Generating innovative solutions to solve complex problems. Developing embedded software/firmware to implement, integrate and support Low Power Wireless Software Networking Stack Features and Whole Product Features. Driving opportunities for deploying best practices across our software portfolio. Creating and executing functional tests for your embedded software. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering or related field of study 3+ years of relevant experience Proficiency in programming/scripting in C, Python Revision control tools experience: git Preferred Qualifications Proficiency in programming/scripting in C, C++, Python Experience with embedded RTOS, wireless communications and serial interfaces. Experience with the automotive software development lifecycle (ASPICE, ISO26262) Revision control tools experience: git Experience with Jenkins, Jira, Confluence, TestLink Strong verbal and written communication skills Experience with creating high/low level design documents Experienced with embedded development, debug and validation. Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with team members across functions. Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment Ability to take initiative and drive for results.
